Our Seat:  They must have had about 15-20 extra waiters and staff sort of loitering around the restaurant.  It was super awkward.  Here's what is more awkward: having those waiters hovering over your table, waiting for their orders from the cafeteria (or was it a kitchen?), talking about clubs, their nights, conquests and misc. other adventures.

Appetizers:  Very good.  Let's say B+.  Stuffed peppers.  Best part of the meal.

Entrees:  This was where it just got bad.  Two terrible entrees.  Mezza Chicken Limone tasted like I was eating straight egg.  Zero flavor unless you ate a moutful of salt and capers.

Do yourself a favor, if you want a chain Italian restaurant in Las Vegas, head on over to the Macaroni Grill and save yourself some time and money.  (Yes, it was bad enough for me to recommend Macaroni Grill)

I had my daughters baby shower here. Let me tell you I was a pain with all my changes. The banquet manager, Nova was very helpful and patient. At the event the room was beautiful, service great and the food was really good. I did not have one complaint!

A franchise restaurant in a mall adjacent to the airport posing as Le Circe with prices that are far too expensive for a dressed up Macaroni Grill with vaulted ceilings that are unable to mute nor dampen the subway station levels of noise on the main dining floor.

I love this place. Its good simple Italian Food, drinks are great and the service is on top of it. The moment you walk in they are very welcoming and happy. 

The Best: Food Food Food
I love a simple pasta with great service.
My girlfriend and I especially enjoy the desserts! Lava Cake! Amazing

Brio Rocks

3 Stars - Food. The bruschetta was good but not outstanding.  Insalata caprese was very good with nice mozarella.  The pasta vodka was overspiced, overcooked, and unimpressive.
2 Stars - Atmosphere. Much of the silverware was dirty and had to be sent back before we even started. The restaurant itself was very loud and felt more like a shopping mall than a restaurant. 
1.5 Stars - Staff.  Bored, unattentive, and seemed bothered when we ordered. 
1 Star - Price.  Go elsewhere to get intimate or authentic.  Come here if you want to show off poor spending choices for a friend or relative you don't particularly like.

I took my mom and her best friend here when they were visiting from out of town for their birthdays.  I read the reviews on Yelp and decided I'd give it a try.  We had had a bad experience the night before with a server and then Allen L at Brio blew them out of the water!  His service made all the difference in the world to our experience there.  I could tell it was busy, but he never seemed too rushed to answer our questions and recommend items in great detail.  

The food was outstanding, as were all his recommendations.  From the wine, to the food, to the service... Brio was outstanding.  We had the Bruschetta Sampler, Gorgonzola Lamb Chops, & Pasta Pomodoro with Chicken...all were fantastic!! 

Thank you so much!  I'll be visiting again soon!

Looked like they were giving food and drinks away here. 
from 5pm til about 9ish ----almost seat was taken.
tastefully decorated,
happy hour is happening
Crab cakes were delicious, 
2 and they were small, I think their portions can be a bit larger,
especially for what they charged.
outside seating as well.

Came to Brio for their happy hour. It was Bomb Diggity! Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant is a must! Outside seating is sooo pleasant. 

As for service that depends on the person. I sat in two different areas. The first server wasn't too pleasant, but the second was phenomenal!

One BIG complaint... although outside seating is wonderful, there happy hour outside seating is not so nice... limited to about 12 - 20 people. One star off for that one.

AMAZING!  Everyone absolutely loved their food.  Often times pastas are uninspiring more often than not, but not at Brio.  Ambiance is excellent, service was also top notch and yum yum yum to every bite we took.  We will be back again and again!

I'm writing a review solely to the HH. 
I was able to try a few items when a friend hosted a BBQ and had the food catered. I was really surprised at how good down of the dishes were, and went to the restaurant the next day. 

Their happy hour deal is AMAAAAAAZING, since you can try their signature dishes for a potion of the price. Too bad it's only on weekdays, but it is definitely worth checking out.

I was not fond of the alcoholic beverages whatsoever...the mojito didn't taste like a mojito. They hadn't crushed the mint leaves so the flavor was one noted. We had to ask for mint too, since there were two leaves in there. 

The Manhattan was just terrible. 

Let me move onto the food though...
Flat bread pizza - 5/5 stars
Shrimp and zuchinni - 5/5 stars 
Beef carpaccio- 5/5 stars 

Everything else was 3-4 stars delicious!

Consistently good.  Good service.  Good location.  They messed up my order, but made it right and took care of us.  We left happy.  Even if something goes wrong they make it right.  The food was great.  We will be back again sometime.
Food was cold today and pizza should be hot.  Service was so slow,  by the time it was fixed I wasn't hungry.  Sad cause food and service usually pretty good.

An old friend of mine turned me on to Brio and I fell in love! I have never experienced bad service at the Tivoli Village location. The down fall for my husband and I is that the bill can add up quite quickly, by the time we have added drinks, salads and a few of those little mini desserts. It's worth it though, the peach sangria (get the pitcher) is yummo, and those mini desserts are even better! 
My husband can be a picky eater too, and he is always able to find something on the menu that he can eat. The kids menu is pretty good too, the kids hamburger is huge and they love the fries!

Brio is located in Tivoli village off of Rampart and Alta.  It is probably the longest standing restaurant in Tivola as many others have gone out of business or relocated since Tivoli opened (Petra, Radio City Pizza, etc).  The ambience inside is comfortable.  The service was attentive and helpful.  The food was okay, but could have wowed a bit more.  I had the lamb chops which were inconsistently cooked (some rare, some over), but the flavor was good.  My partner had the beef medallions with asparagus coating.  These were also pretty good, but nothing I would return for.  Overall, I think Brio was a good one time experience for me, but maybe I will try out their happy hour after reading some of the other reviews.

I had dinner with the family and decided too try Brio again since couple weeks ago the wait was too long for my brother guys my nieces. Happily not much of wait at all most part soon walked in got seated. They had live band playing outside that night outside on the patio. So the place had nice lively vibe too it especially around the patio/bar area. So I do need too come back because like the whole outdoor, open fire pit, and HH prices looks like steal. 

I came in for dinner with the family. We ordered two appetizers too share start artichoke spinach dip and calamari. Both really good. I enjoyed about the artichoke spinach dip was the fact it came with lavosh crackers rather then typical beard. It gave the dish another spin with the crispy lavosh topped with nice hot dip on top! It was nice creamy texture, vibrant green color, and great flavor. The calamari was solid nice crispy moist hot on in the inside comes with two different sauce one traditional marinade sauce and other not sure. Each sauce paired nice with the crispy calamari. Both were great starter before our entrees.

I had the chicken milanese. Break it down same as chicken parmesan. The chicken breast had perfect golden crust on the outside nice crispy and cooked perfectly on the inside! It was nice HOT and moist throughout! It served on bed of noodles cooked perfectly and saute with in some kind of butter sauce. Outside around the bed of pasta had red sauce. I really enjoyed everything on the plate nothing left too show!

The atmosphere feel like upscale version of Olive Garden. The prices are not that really upscale might be slightly more expensive then Olive Garden. It great alternative if looking for Italian food. The staff there from time walked in too our server all greeted us with smile, warm welcome, and fabulous job! If in the near the area would stop by again.

I have been to Brio multiple times and we always leave satisfied. They have cheap lunch specials which are always tasty. Last time I ordered a chop salad and a flatbread for like $7 and I had left-overs!

For dinner they have great pastas and meat dishes. I also love their panini's and salad combo. They also have weekday specials with $5 martini's on wednesdays!
I like the vibes of Italy @Brio, the food is great especially the happy hour @the bar! Check it out!

This place is awesome! The food, the atmosphere and everything else! My best bro n i went here for happy hour and the food is awesome! We got two brio burgers, Carpaccio, and we got the italian lemonade and the white peach sangria! Everything was amazing and the bill was very cheap!

Jim was the best bartender ever! He had the best hospitality and was very friendly! Hes awesome! Keep it up Boss and thank you for everything!

Big fan of this restaurant! First time at this location and it won't be my last. We started with the Roasted Garlic, Spinach, and Artichoke Dip with a Parmesan Flat Bread. One of the best I've had; the ones I usually get are too salty and lacking in flavor, but this one was perfect.

As an entree I got the Pasta Pesto, my father got the Pasta Brio (his go to), and our friends got the Ravioli di Bello, and Balsamic Braised Beef Short Rib. 

The Pasta Pesto was amazing. Didn't want too hardy of a sauce and too much food so this dish was perfect. It had a light sauce (since usually pasta dishes have too much). The Pasta Brio...there is no wrong with this dish! Again, not an overwhelming sauce, portion is bigger than the Pasta Pesto, but perfect for eating it the next day. I can't vouch for the Short Rib and Ravioli, but I know our friends enjoyed it VERY much. 

Our waiter was great. He made the experience even better. Great recommendations, very personable, made us feel very welcomed. Also, it was my Aunt's birthday 2 days prior and we mentioned it casually and he ended up bringing a small dessert for her without us even asking. Haven't had service like this for a while.

We sat outside since the weather is getting nicer to do so in Las Vegas!!! Some friends joined up for happy hour as Brio is about the best in town. Sometimes the service at this location is questionable but this visit we had great service and, unfortunately, I cannot remember her name:(  As always, the food and drinks were great!
Over priced food and not that great. Have been here several times and each time I get even more disappointed as the portion of the food reduces and the prices increases.

Waited about 30 min until our food arrived.
The food wasn't all that great but good enough.

My husband and I always pass Brio and talk about going there one day for dinner. Tonight we finally had dinner here and we were happy with everything!! Customer service and the food was awesome, the atmosphere was a plus!! We'll will most definitely be back.
This bar has the best Happy Hour in Las Vegas! If you ever stop in, make sure you ask for Bri, she provides the best service possible!

Someone called me from Brio and left me a message asking us to come back.
I was unable to hear his name. I feel like the manager should make more than one attempt at inviting us

So we are not big Town Square people, my man doesn't like crowds much so we don't go as often as I would like.  We were there for a specific item and decided to have a few drinks.  While having these drinks we wanted food.  Looking though the options we decided on Brio.  Which amazed and thrilled me, he doesn't like Italian (because he never knows what to order and picks the wrong stuff) I love Italian especially because I get it so rarely! 

I got the caesar salad, yummy.  Perfect amount of dressing to food.  He got the Wedge Bistecca Insalata, he loves wedges so he was happy.  He finally followed my lead and got what I ordered, the Lobster & Shrimp Fettuccine.  His mouth watered when he saw it and he finished my leftovers when we got home.  So finally we can eat Italian and he will be happy, I can't wait to come back!

Nice atmosphere. Reasonable service on a very busy night. The roasted veggies were good. The lemon chicken was hard and dry, not at all warm and they were stingy with the butter. We had to ask several times for more bread and butter. This was not my typical experience here, the lunch experience was much better.

Refer to my review of Brio Tuscan Grille at Town Square: http://www.yelp.com/biz/brio-tuscan-grille-las-vegas#hrid:72dL3FhMlp7omkE4eh5lLA

My fiancé and I first experienced this location at their grand opening event benefiting AFAN (Aid for AIDS of Nevada) in April 2011. We were immediately impressed with the set-up and interior of the restaurant. Compared to the Town Square (Las Vegas) location, it has an "open" feeling since the whole seating area of the restaurant is under one beautiful canopy of drapes. The outdoor seating has a beautiful view of the center of Tivoli Village.

I thoroughly enjoy both Las Vegas locations and merely choose one based on where I am in the valley at the time!
Speedy and professional service. I like the healthier menus. Quinoa Asparagus with Grilled Chicken was my fave.

Although I must have been sat in the worst seat in the house, the atmosphere in this Brio was still excellent. My guest and I were seated right after a supremely difficult woman, the type that just makes a fuss about everything. This made for some interesting dinner conversation, to say the least, and the staff seemed to handle her well. Certainly better than I could have! I came to the conclusion throughout dinner that our waiter was not supposed to be taking care of our section but was just picking up the slack for another waiter or trying to get some extra tables. Even despite this, I am certain I will be back.

First off, the bread is sourdough! Any restaurant that has a default option of sourdough bread, sign me up. I had the lobster and shrimp fettucini and a chopped salad. Other Yelpers don't lie when they praise the chopped salad here! The shrimp and lobster pasta was as good as any I have ever head but still when I come back I think I will order a chopped salad. On the menu it is $5 and comes as a side, so maybe order two and ask them to combine it into a bowl. I am honestly surprised there is no entree option for this salad but I guess most people don't come to an Italian restaurant to have their cheapest salad option. It is that good though, so do yourself a favor and order it!
I like Brio. I have been there several times but the service in/at the bar is, simply put, TERRIBLE!! very disappointing !! bartenders are rude, clueless.

I wish I could give 0 stars. The food here is good, but the management is terrible. We brought a (good) bottle of wine to enjoy with our dinner. The server told us she couldn't open it. We asked to speak to a manager. She told us that they had a very good wine list and it was against the law to open the bottle. Since members in our party were in the industry they knew this was untrue (especially since we purchased one bottle also). Also she made no effort at a service recovery (we would've refused it anyway, but the effort would've been respectable). So terrible management ruined our meal.

My 93 year-old Father-in-Law, husband and I have lunch every Thursday somewhere in town and Brio is one of our favorites.  Not only is the Valet parking virtually right outside their entrance to make it convenient for Dad's walker (and stamina), the greeting we received by the host and hostess was genuine.  From the moment we sat down the waiter and other staff were very attentive and made us feel welcomed.  From the outrageously good sourdough bread to the coffee at the end of the meal, we enjoyed our time together in a relaxing, beautiful atmosphere.  Thank you Tom (our waiter) and Jesse (manager) for a special day at your fine restaurant.  We will continue to come back more often.

Beachbody dish: 2 fillets of Blackened Salmon, medium rare, over chopped salad
Plenty of good protein with a healthy serving of veggies

Another good protein snack is the beef cappacio, ask for no salt / light capers to cut down on the sodium

I miss their linguine frutti de mare (shellfish pasta on red sauce).

Basket of bread is complimentary after you place a food order and use your Brio rewards (give either Brio # or the registered phone #) to earn $ off or free meals.  They have a generous rewards program and it's worth it.

Brio is very good especially for the price. The lemon chicken is excellent service is good staff is mostly friendly. Bartenders pour a good drink especially if you are sitting at the bar and are specific about what you want (strength of drink and what not)

Been here twice now and have been very impressed. First time was for dinner; great food! Second for drinks; very strong!
The service is the one thing that really stands out. Every member of the team always has a big smile on their face and they are very polite and helpful during interactions. 
I will definitely be back and highly recommend Brio to everyone in Vegas. 

Keep up the good work!

Great happy hour spot! There are big, circular booths in the bar area that are perfect for a group of girlfriends after work. HH drinks are between $4-5 and appetizers are about the same and perfect for sharing around the table. 
The place doesn't have a ton of personality, but the food, drinks, and service are wonderful.

Ah the happiest of happy hours! I'm not sure how it took me so long to try one of Brio's happy hours, but I'm so glad I finally did. My girlfriend and I came here on a Monday evening around 6pm and were easily able to snag two seats at the bar. I personally loved the service and set up at this location. It seemed a bit more intimate than the town square one. 

As for food we shared the tomato mozzarella salad, beef carpaccio and black pepper shrimp. I honestly loved everything I ate. The salad was very fresh and well balanced on the ingredients. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and had just the right amount of spice to it. The carpaccio was delicious and not too thin like you tend to get at some other restaurants.

100% I cannot wait to come back again and try more of the menu options. You also can never go wrong with $5 drink specials. Thank you Brio!

I have eaten at many restaurants in my lifetime. I have also dined at Brio many times & the food is always spot on. My wife & I had quite possibly the nicest, most attentive & genuinely kind server in the world. His name is Logan & he is special. Please ask for him, you won't be disappointed. He is attending UNLV putting himself through college.

Brio rocks!  I had made a reservation for my daughter's teenage soccer team and the parents who traveled along.  The tables were ready for us when we got there, and the servers(JJ, Brad, and Fred) were pleasant and provided us with great service.  Our meals were delicious and the drinks were so yummy!  It was the perfect way to end an incredibly hectic day.  Thanks Brio!

Great dining experience.  I typically love Brio for business lunches but decided to bring a date for dinner.  She loved it.

Started with the bruschetta quatro.  4 different types of bruschetta.  All delicious.  I ordered the crab and shrimp cakes.  Very tasty with large pieces of crab and shrimp throughout.  My date ordered the tilapia which was cooked perfectly.  

All with a few glasses of sangria thrown in made for a lovely date.

I want to thank Jessie for his outstanding generosity.  While he couldn't lower the noise he did comp us for two meals which were superb.  I guess they were having a bad day the other day.  I will continue to eat there with great delight.

The service is terrible. The girl who sat us was rude. It took over seven minutes for anyone to even acknowledge we were there.  After we finally got drinks and a menu, we were hurried to order our food. When our meal arrived, it was cold and the flatbread was soggy.There's too many good restaurants in this town to deal with bad service and mediocre food.

Pretty much what you would expect from a nice chain.  The food is decent, but not too creative.  The patio is a great location when the weather is decent and the drinks are just fine.  I sampled the Tuscan Stuffed Peppers, the Bruschetta and the Calamari. 
The stuffed peppers were the best with a nice mix of sausage and creamy cheese filling.  Calamari was decent, cooked properly, but not outstanding.  The bruschetta was our least favorite - the bread was very dry, without enough moisture from the toppings to soften it.  This resulted in the entire piece crumbling after the first bite.
Our service was fine.

Happy hour rocks!  The food is incredible and the price is right! 

Beef Carpaccio - Field greens, capers, mustard aioli, Parmesan 3.95. My favorite!  

Margherita Flatbread - Fresh Mozzarella, vine-ripened tomatoes, fresh basil 3.95

Sausage & Pepperoni Flatbread - Ricotta, Mozzarella, Provolone, housemade tomato sauce 4.95

BRIO Burger* - Provolone, roasted tomato mayonnaise, housemade chips 5.95

Tomato Mozzarella Salad - Vine-ripened tomatoes, fresh Mozzarella, field greens, basil, balsamic drizzle, lemon vinaigrette 4.95

And more.  Also, The Patio is great when the weather is nice.

This is our first time trying this restaurant. The location of this place in Tivoli is beautiful. As well the interior of the restaurant. The server we got was nice and helpful. Stars for the looks but the food was even worse than Olive Garden which I'm giving 0 star. My husband and I have traveled across U.S. and even out of the country and that's how we learned how to love food. And we love love love fried calamari. The calamari we got was too much breading, tasteless and hard. The worst calamari we ever had that we could not even finish it (and I hate wasting food). And the lasagna and pasta we got were OK(i would say applebee's quality)
Service was amazing, server was an act in himself with my shot-drinking girlfriends at brunch. Lobster bisque was incredible. Loved everything!!

This was my first trip to Brio and it won't be the last. The bar was pretty packed for a spy on vegas open bar from 6-9. We managed to snag the last 3 seats at the bar at 5:45 which was lucky considering it was standing room only by 6:30. The service was definitely above average, quick and courteous even when they were swamped with all the event goers. I can't comment on the drink prices during happy hour because we were taking advantage of the free peach sangria and cucumber gin gimlets but the $2.95 tasting menu in the bar area is fabulous.  
The Ravioli Caprese arrived with 3 generously sized pieces of ravioli in marinara sauce. Not only was this dish tasty, but for $3 I was impressed by the portion size. The Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant was my favorite of the dishes we ordered. The portion is smaller than the ravioli but the flavor makes up for the size. So good, and only $3. We'll order two of those next time. The Margherita Flatbread was a little bland for my taste but between the other dishes and the bartenders plying us with free booze it's hard to complain.

I have only been here for happy hour but tonight we decided to sit down for dinner and I'm glad we did.  We had some of the most amazing food.  I highly recommend the gluten free chicken pesto.  We had amazing service with Kirsten so if you get a chance ask for her.

Love their happy hour. Once of the best ones in town. It use to be 2.95 awhile back ago. They raised the appetizer prices to 3.95... but seriously, it's worth it. 3.95 is still a steal especially for this girl! 

Not much of a bar area compared to their other location at town square. It's also quite busy so if you don't go there early, you may not get a seat. 

Appetizers we ordered:
1) Brio burger: Cut into 4. Simple burger.. but really well done. A fluffy bread with a juicy patty. 
2) Ravioli Caprese: 5 pieces of breaded cheese ravioli. Fried to perfection. 
3) Beef Carpaccio: MY FAVORITE DISH. Thinly sliced salty meat. What more could you ask for?
4) Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant: Another delicious dish.
5) Crispy Shrimp Piccante: Boyfriend l

It was more than enough for the both of us but we seriously wanted to try everything. 
The drinks are delicious. Just martinis mostly. No beer. But well, it's all good. Cause I have my 3.95 appetizers.

I was always a fan of brio since there is one closer to me that's located at town square.  I think i like this one better though.  It is close to valet and it seems bigger.  I order the calamari and caprese salad with fresh mozzarella cheese and basil with balsamic glaze drizzled around the plate.  These were Pretty easy and typical dishes that u go wrong with at brio.

I love this place. I've tried both locations on town now (Town Square & Tivoli) and I've had 2 great dining experiences.

Very cheap happy hour at the bar from 3:30pm-6:30pm and reverse happy hour from 9pm-close where all the food on the happy hour menu is only $2.95! The only drink specials I saw were $5 martinis on Thursday's.

Service was friendly and very welcoming and the food at is amazing. I recommend the Pasta Brio, which is rigatoni with a seared mushroom and peppers sauce, the Pasta alla Vodka, homemade pasta filled with ricotta, and the seared shrimp risotto is also delicious. Portions are good for the price and the menu has a lot of choices.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in town. Everything is a hit in this place and if you haven't tried it yet you should get in your car and drive down there right now.

This is another one of those places I've visited a dozen times or more in a variety of locations, but seem to fail to check in most of the time.  The accumulated experiences mandate that it's time for a review.

For a chain, I think it's one of the better ones.  Brio's food is consistently good and most of the time, above average for a chain restaurant.  We find ourselves going there with some frequency lately since this location is just a few miles from the house, in the nearby and still growing Tivoli Village.  Easy to get to, great underground parking (a huge plus in the summertime!), and a nice place to stroll after overeating.  (Yep, it's gonna happen.)

The food:  Two visits ago I had the Pasta Fra Diavalo.  Not my first pasta dish here because they do a great job with not overcooking the pasta.  The flavors were wonderful as alway and the dish was served at just the right temperature.  I don't know if they heat their dishes, but I noticed that the bowl didn't cause the pasta to cool rapidly--something that happens too often at many restaurants.  During my most recent visit I was able to sample a number of new tasty menu items:  a fresh Caprese Salad.  It was especially specially fresh and had just the right amount of dressing to allow the mild tomatoes and mozzarella to shine through.  Next the group of us shared a Sausage and Pepperoni Flatbread, cooked well so that the flatbread was at just the right place between soft and too crisp.  Next, Black Pepper Shrimp featuring middle-sized, peeled shrimp served on slices of eggplant and drizzled in a fantastic sauce.  Brio found a great way to combine shrimp and eggplant into what became an instant favorite.  I'll definitely order it again.  I sampled Brio's take on bread pudding for dessert and was pleasantly surprised.  I wouldn't normally order bread pudding, but I'm glad I had the chance to try this.  The portion was just right to follow a full meal and the pudding and sauce were delicious.  I'd definitely get it again.

The beverages:  If you're in the mood for a little wine with your dinner, I recommend the White Peach Sangria.  I'm not a fan of sweet wines or drinks, but this was nice and refreshing, and not too sweet to keep me from enjoying it.

The service:  Top notch for this kind of restaurant.  The staff is always there taking care of you, but they're not in the way or hovering.  I also love that they'll always tell you the specials, then make recommendations if you prefer.  I almost always ask and when recommendations come, they seem genuine rather than what might otherwise feel like they were told to push a particular dish that day.

Overall, well done Brio!

I would give this place more than five stars if I could. The food is so delicious, and their outside patio is awesome! I love the pasta alla vodka. They have so many amazing appetizers too. The shrimp and eggplant, and calamari are my favorites. The service here is beyond great. My husband and I spent three hours here on our first date, and eat here at least once a month.  Everything has always been perfect.

I love me some Brio! Yeah I am sure this will be a real balanced review...  At any rate I really enjoy the Brio at the Town Square location and thought I would give this new spot in Summerlin a try for a casual business dinner. I will save you sometime and just let you know it was a real solid choice. The food came out very quickly and the happy hour specials were priced rather inexpensively. Mid way through our meal the executive chef made his rounds and made sure to say hello to every table and introduce himself.  I have to say thats a rarity and the touch was well received.  I honestly have no problems recommending this place to anyone as the bruschetta choices are all amazing, the Veal Milanese was great, the ravioli were cooked to perfection, and the wine list had some great choices for excellent prices.

My boyfriend and I came to Brio, already lovers of the chain restaurant (townsquare our favorite pick), thinking it would be the same great experience. In the beginning we were told 30-40 minute wait and since it's Homecoming weekend in Vegas, we understood and the lady manager took my name and handed me a pager. We sat RIGHT OUTSIDE and waited not long after were pleasantly surprised that another woman manager with a bun came up to us with a flatbread to take a piece while we waited. We were so grateful that she not only offered us a snack, but thanked us for waiting. Patronage is a huge thing in local restaurants and being thanked for waiting is a rare commodity.

Well an hour passes and we finally get up And walk inside. We ask how much longer to be told they were paging us for 15 mins?? Apparently they gave us a broken pager that was fully lot and functional. Thanks to the First Lady manager. We're surprised at this considering there were 4 hostesses and 2 managers, not one of them would've walked outside to call our name? 

At that point they handed my boyfriend a new charger and expected us to wait more. At that point I walked over to the bar and say down. THANK THE SERVING GODS for Kelly at the bar because she made up for my irritated and highly agitated night. 2 stars is for her and her ONLY. No more Tivoli Village Brio for us.

They have an awesome happy hour, but unfortunately we missed it by 5 minutes. No one else's fault but ours. I had a corona and my husband had a couple long islands. The bbq chicken flat bread was good, nothing special. This place kind of never hits the spot for me, and the food is always just O.K. This time we even knew the assistant manager but it didn't help that the restaurant was so crowded and servers looked a little overwhelmed. I really like the atmosphere thought, so might go back again for happy hour.

Food was great. The ravioli in vodka sauce was excellent. Tiramisu was really good too. Place was packed on a Wednesday night. My boy Donovan said it was Cougar city for anyone who cares. He also said happy hours are great. They also have drink specials like $5 Martinique on Wednesday

Let's get one thing straight - I love Brio at Town Square, so after going to the Kidville CYME today (8/22/11,) I headed over here at 11:30 AM. The place was pretty dead, save for a handful of tables. Literally, you could count the tables that were full on one hand. My three siblings and I were sat at a booth right next to the kitchen (annoying) and given menus. 

Our waiter would periodically pop in to say that he would be with us in a minute and after a little over 10 minutes, we finally got to order our waters. 5-7 minutes later, he ask if we still needed time with the menu or if we were ready to order. We were ready. After the wait, my sister and I were talking about just getting up and leaving - it's aggravating to be discriminated against because we're young. Don't put us in the back by the kitchen because we have two kids with us and don't ignore us because you think you won't get a good tip. Bad service, like what was exhibited, equals a bad tip.

Anyway, I ordered the lunch portion of the sweet potato & chicken risotto with the bistecca salad ($12.95.) My sister got the fettuccine rustica ($9.95) and then our younger siblings got the kid's ravioli ($4.95) and the kid's fettuccine alfredo ($4.50.) 

My food was okay but extremely salty/ msg-ish. It had that overwhelming umami flavor that comes with excessive msg so that made me leery. I actually got really full quite quickly and couldn't finish it all. Also, the risotto was kind of unappetizing with the cubes of not soft sweet potato and green beans. It was edible, but I wouldn't order it again. My sister complained that her pasta was also extra salty and she left most of the "goodies" in her bowl. The kids liked their pasta - it actually came in the same size bowls as our meals with the same sized portions. I was actually worried that the waiter didn't write that they were kids' meals.  

We got one water refill about 5 minutes before we got the check. We would have ordered dessert but my sister said she was really sick of constantly waiting for our waiter so I paid $40 and we bounced. Go to Brio at Town Square at Happy Hour if you want a great deal and great service. Come to Brio at Tivoli Village if you want to be ignored and leave unsatisfied with your meal.

Very beautiful Italian restaurant w/gr8 food and good service.  Nice wine list and bar menu w/gr8 happy hour.  Pasta dishes, grilled dishes and appetizers are my favorites.  Eggplant and shrimp, beef carpaccio, calamari, ravioli, lasagna, vodka penne and mahi mahi are recommended.   Desserts are average. Service is slow sometimes.

I have eaten at both locations in Las Vegas and they're both excellent.

Pros: Food is always great. I've never had a single bad dish and tried many. Lasagna is my absolute favorite and it's smothered in cheese, it's incredible. Drinks are always good and if you sit on the patios you get great views at either location.

Cons: None, place is pretty great

I will definitely continue eating here as often as possible

I'm going to agree with my friends Stefany and Clint. 

 I must quote Clint, "The food is medicore at best".

We went there with my son and his wife. The last time I went to a Brio was the Town Square location, with my wife, on our second date, four years ago. It hasn't improoved in that time. 

My chopped dinner salad was a good portion, but very dry and tasteless.  My wife had the "big" pork chop. It was big and meaty, but very dry. My daughter in law had a chicken dish worthy of a cheap buffet. I forgot what my son ordered, but I tasted it, and it wasn't very good.

The service was very good. Our bread baket was constantly refilled, our drinks always full, and when my wife complained to the manager about her dry pork, the manager did offer a substitute, but we were already full (mostly of bread).  She did send a comp'd desert as a way of saying "sorry".

Even though the service was very good, I would say it was a Rich Man's Bucca Di Peppo, with smaller portions, and an alternative for a High School Date to The Olive Garden.

On a Mommy Daughter date night & the level of service reviewed by Adeline and complimented further by Stephanie, made the experience fabulous. They well exceeded our expectations. The filet was perfectly prepared, service was quick, & the ambiance on the patio ..amazing!

I've been to brio at town square and selected items are good.  Others not so much.   I was totally turned off by just coffee and dessert here.  Coffee want memorable and cheesecake was old and disgusting.    Our server was coughing up a lung and should have been sent home 

I am giving it two stars just because my experience at the other location was ok.  Otherwise it would not even get two!

You cant go wrong with Brio, I have been to both locations Rampart and Town Sq and they have a good happy hr menu along with a lunch/dinner menu.. if you are looking to eat dinner at one of these locations, I recommend making reservations. Service is always on point and there is always something for everyone with in your party..

I visited this location and ate the Roasted Vegetable Spaghetti (Add chciken breast)on the recommendation of the server. The meal was very good. The service from Amanda F was great, super friendly and very efficient. The atmosphere was pleasing, modern, and the dining area was clean.
Over priced pasta dishes and horrible service. Happy hour is the only hour I'll return to this place and only because I'm out voted by friends.

Let me start off by saying this isn't just your average Yelp review, we actually had our wedding reception at this Brio location this past Sat, Aug 16th 2014, and we could not be happier. We live in Los Angeles and were planning a wedding in Las Vegas, so I was very nervous about planning this via email and telephone, however the GM was extremely kind and helpful. First off, lets start with the fact that this location doesn't even have a "wedding"/or banquet room, the first time I called the manager informed me about their other location closer to the strip that had space to accommodate large parties and I explained to her that because our ceremony was in Summerlin, we wanted our reception to be there too so that guests wouldn't have to drive so far back and forth from the strip. She completely understood and welcomed our business. So, instead of taking up the majority of their restaurant on a Saturday night, they gave us the patio as well as a wrap around lounge area. Again, I was a little skeptical about the idea of my reception being on a patio, but we were running out of time and options within our budget and we booked Brio mostly because of their kind professionalism and because the food sounded delicious.

So, we began planning our menu, I emailed the GM probably around 20-30 times in the course of 3 months, and every time she responded within 24 hours and never seemed bothered or irritated. She allowed us to have table decorations and when I explained I was worried my family member would miss the ceremony due to setting up the tables, she offered to have some employees set up the dining area for us, and never even mentioned a service charge. Amazing. Also, she accommodated us with our menu choices completely and everyone in at our reception said the food was amazing and that they were going to look up the nearest Brio in their areas.

 I'll save you all the sob story, but basically we had some hiccups at our ceremony (insane photographer) and we were about ready to tell the limo driver to just keep driving and not even take us to our reception when we pulled up to this amazingly beautiful, twinkly lit patio that took both of our breath away. We ended up having the most amazing reception. We danced. We drank. We laughed. We cried. It was everything I wanted for my wedding and I have Brio to thank for it. Not only did our reception at Brio make up for a pretty lousy ceremony, they also told us "not to rush" and to "stay as long as we're enjoying ourselves". That is amazing. The servers not only went above and beyond all night long, they were attentive, personable, extremely quick and one of the girls even danced with my brother who has Down's Syndrome. She was such a sweetheart. I have never experienced such great service along with such amazing food in such a beautiful restaurant. Brio truly has it all. We are eternally grateful because you gave us the most beautiful wedding reception we could have asked for.

I could eat the carpaccio all day. It's THAT good, and not filling. The server was also really nice and down to earth. She would even joke with us. I haven't tried any other food at this location, so take what you want from this review.

I used to go to the brio in town square every time I was in town, but this one is just as good, without the crowd. And it's closer to where I stay. 

PS...I've recently stopped eating meat. When I ordered my usual dish (a pasta with chicken, pine nuts, tomatoes, idk what it's called but it's delicious) but asked for it without chicken, the waiter asked if I wanted to sub anything in it's place. Yes please! I asked for eggplant. I think I enjoyed it more with the eggplant than I ever did with the chicken. Hopefully if I end up at another location at some point they will do the same.

I'm glad there are so many great reviews here.  Too bad mine won't be one of them.  Went there for brunch and I ordered the Ham & Biscuit Benedict.  The only thing warm on the plate was the hollandaise sauce and even then it was barely warm.  I would have liked to have told the server that everything was cold but, sadly, she didn't bother to check back to see how everything was.  I don't know when the potatoes or asparagus were prepared but I'm not even certain that they were made the same day.  Tasted like leftovers that I could pull out of my own refrigerator.  Maybe it's that particular dish that they don't prepare very well but I did not enjoy my meal or the service.  Atmosphere is nice though.

Normally i don't bother with town squaresince it's not my scene   but friend wanted to come for happy hour.  Service was great,  our waitress was friendly and attentive. The happy hour food and drinks were good,  the artichoke dip was delicious. The pineapple drink had a good balance of flavor and alcohol, forgot its offical name.  It was a nice atmosphere even when it got crowded.

Conveniently located in a great neighborhood is all I can say for this trip?  Service was professional and friendly -most in our party were happy with dinner - just wasn't my day, I guess?  :-( .  Restaurant and restrooms were noticeably... well, could be cleaner?  Meals were small in portion, wine was way over-priced for the offering or am I spoiled by COSTCO?  ha, ha.  Fry cook for a chef?  Don't order the Salmon.  I've been very please in several visits in the past... don't know if there was a change in managers or the kitchen might just be having a bad day?  I'll try em again - and might pick up the tab next time :-) Thank you Bob, for dinner - the company was awesome!

Brio had great atmosphere and food!

Cocktails: cucumber Basil gimlet, was so super tastey.  It was like freshest, coolest lemonade I've ever had. My favorite item by far and it was only $7.50!
I also had a glass of Sketchbook pinot noir and it was nice with dinner and reasonably priced at $9.00 a glass.

Food: The caprese salad was good quality ingredients and reasonably portioned. My only complaint is it def needed more balsamic. Their balsamic is a good one by the way.
We also had the lasagna bolognese. This item was really tastey. Nothing crazy extravagant and certainly nothing to complain about. It was just a great item 
The prices were pretty good in my opinion. 10-20 a person without drinks.
When we got there we were seated on the patio. The weather was fantastic so that only added to the awesome atmosphere. 

My only complaint for the evening was our waitress. She was a total bug a boo. I felt rushed and like she wanted us out of there. 
However, the staff was amazing other than her and I can tell she was the only annoying staff member.

I was coming here since this place (finally) opened on my side of town.  The happy hour is just amazing.  It was $2.99 for like 8 different dishes, but I recently went back and was disappointed to find that happy hour dishes are now $3.99.  The bartender told me they have some newer items, and the portions are bigger.  I wouldn't know as I went for the burger, which did not change in size.  They also told me they added $5 cocktails, which also didn't matter to me as I was drinking a regular priced Stella, if I remember correctly.

I came back a few weeks later and had two apps, the beef carpaccio and the crispy shrimp.  I almost always get the carpaccio, so I was pretty excited when indeed a bigger plate arrived.  Except once I was digging in, I found that they had sliced the meat thinner than before, and so it seemed like the same amount... or LESS!  The meat kind of stuck to the plate, so it wasn't the same enjoyable appetizer that I was used to.

The crispy shrimp were a nice addition to the menu, though.  Tasty, plentiful, and not too much breading.  I definitely enjoyed that.  I also tried a $5 sangria rosa just so I could sample their drink menu, and it was good, but it didn't blow me away.

This is still one of the best happy hours on this side of town, but it's not the "oh my god we have to go there" deal that it once was.

Of the two locations, this is the better. Happy hour is the only reason that brings me to Brio. For Italian food, there are better venues around Vegas. As for HH, this is one of the better. 

The offering of drinks tend to sway my judgement. The Town Square location lacks drink offerings. For $5, a decent size list of specialty cocktails has something for most. 

The two food items I ordered was enough to tide me over. The beef carpaccio with mixed greens is one of my regularly favorites. The shrimp with eggplant was a solid option as well. As an in between snack to banish hunger, a better deal is hard to come by. 

One drink and two appetizers for $14. Check please.

We only had drinks there since we arrived late and our friends were already done eating. Service was good and the waitress was very friendly. The drinks were good and I would consider returning in the future to try their food. They have $5 happy hour on weekdays too
They always make my regular meal perfect. Salmon and angel hair pasta with no tomatoes. It's always ready for pickup when I get there as well, love this place, well the salmon

1 star for the server in the bar and the manager. Went in early during happy hour. Was seated immediately, greeted by male server and drink order taken. Server said he'd bring a happy hour menu. Another food runner/server brought the cocktail to me and I waited 15 minutes...for a menu. 

5 stars for the hostess (all of them, actually--every time). I asked to be reseated and the hostess was extremely apologetic and quickly took care of the issue. She had the manager take me to a new table. When I explained what happened to him, he said nothing, but "Would you like to order off the bar's happy hour menu in the main restaurant?" While I appreciated that offer, an apology would have been the appropriate action, talking to the offended server would also have been an appropriate action (I doubt this happened). I've eaten there dozens of times and this manager is severely lacking in customer service skills. 

5 stars for Jennifer the new server. She was friendly, knowledgeable and turned my dining experience around. Thank you Jennifer and the hostesses. Brio almost lost a neighborhood customer.

Whenever I want consistently good food and friendly service I go to Brio... It never disappoints. 

The location in Tivoli village is pretty busy on weekends and Friday night so be sure to call ahead to make reservations. :) 

Food Recommendations: 
I highly recommend the calamari! It's very good and comes with 2 types of sauce. 
The Caesar salad is also great! 
For main courses I suggest the steak salad or the Gorgonzola steak medallions. I've tried other things on the menu and always come back to those two! 
The lava cake is also pretty good! 

The service is consistently good as well! We had a waiter (Alberto I think was his name) that was super attentive and made the experience fun! 

If you have never tried Brio I recommend it!
I've been going to brio for quite some time, and i really like this place. Beautiful patio, good service, and great food would describe it all. My friends and i are regulars already!

Happy hour specials are great :) that's what keeps us coming back. Service here is normally on point. Last weekend we definitely had a hiccup. 4:30 after work on Friday. We were brought appetizer plates that had already been used and a clean plate was put on top. I addressed it with the manager and he comped a couple of the appetizers. Service wasn't very good. We were on the patio and I had to go inside to request service twice. Bummer :( 

Food is delicious and I absolutely love Peroni. We will keep coming back for that. Hopefully service will be on point next visit.

I think you have to adjust a little for it being on Valentine's Day and bearing that in mind it was good. We got there 20 minutes before out 8:45 reservation and were hoping to be seated earlier, but unfortunately it was just super busy and we were seated at res. time. We spent some time looking over the menu and it did take a while to order. My gf ordered the shrimp and lobster pasta which she said was very good if not phenomenal. I ordered the filet only to find a few minutes later that they just ran out. So, I went with the New York Fiorentina which turned out to be quite good as far as New Yorks go (not usually my favorite). Grilled and seasoned very well which is a must for the chewier cut. Overall recommended with friendly and professional service.

Went out to dinner with my son we had a wonderful time sat on patio and we had a wonderful view even The valet parker was nice and helpful The waitress Shell was friendly and engaging recommend it some excellent choices the food was great even the bus person with amazing hair was wonderful The manager Tiffany came over and introduced herself with a bright smile upon receiving the check we excuse ourselves and went to the restroom. We had yummy leftovers that we planned on devouring I'm at the end of our night at home. When we came back to the table all our food was thrown away accidentally. The hostess Alexis was very apologetic and immediately found my server and the manager. Shell was very apologetic and wanted to accommodate us in anyway. The manager Tiffany came right over and apologize and prepared a whole new meal how great now that is some customer service I will be back! The food was wonderful but this service really made our evening thank you for great  great customer service !!!!!

When ever we come in, it's always beyond busy so rather than wait an hour for a table, we usually request to sit at the bar bc there's hardly ever a wait, service is quick and they have tvs for those days when we wanna watch a game.

Carpaccio is my FAV here, I crave for the damn thing. Unfortunately I get too full off of that and the dinner bread that I don't really get the chance to try anything else. DISCLAIMER: I don't eat very much so appetizers usually do me fine as an entry-- don't judge me.

The ONLY complaint that I have about our visits to this restaurant is that the parking SUCKS. We end up putting the car in Valet than bother with parking.

Everyone's talking about this place and I finally had a chance to go with my girlfriend's. We went during their happy hour and the food was great. Each of us ordered the Brio burger and let me tell you, I was impressed that it had great flavor, yet it wasn't heavy like some burgers at restaurants like this. My only compliant was that I ordered it medium, but it was slightly over medium.  However, it was still moist and juicy.   The beef carpaccio was delicious and so was the fried cheese ravioli.  For drinks I had the peach white sangria.  It tasted great and was very refreshing. The prices are the best I've seen yet for happy hour.  I spent about $13 for the burger, carpaccio, and drink.  Not too bad, especially when you're on a budget.  The service was also good. I'll definitely be back.

Excellent food & service ~ ordered the bisque (divine!) chicken Cesar salad & the brio pasta with caramel marscapone cheesecake for dessert YUM!! 
Loved everything

Wow!!  Their happy hour is pretty darn good !!!Inexpensive.  Friend brought me there and was surprised at prices and portions.  Perfect place to hang out after work.  Arrive early ...at least by 4:30 cause seats at the bar fill up quick.  They also have a reward system that will give you dollar discounts on future orders.  Sweet!!!

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Amazing food! Sat in the bar area on 10/17 got here around 8:10pm, everything seem to start off right bartender greeted me within 2 mins, gave me a happy hour menu. I ordered from the happy hour menu and my bartender walked away when he brought my drink over I had to ask for the regular menu. I ordered an Cesar salad, flat bread and lamb chops to eat. All my food came out in an timely manner but my bartender NEVER checked on me. My lamb chops were VERY tasty but came out cold. I had to physically get up and find an manager to come talk to in which they remade my lamb chops and they came out nice and hot! My bartender was aware that I sent back my dish but never followed up. The manager did come back within mins to check on me! Since it was extremely slow and the service suck that's my reason for two stars, I really wanted to rate 1 but the food was too good

Portobello Mushrooms stuffed ravioli  heavenly
Spicy shrimp and eggplant         Wonderful 
Service fantastic

This review is long overdue. My husband and I went in for our date about 3 weeks ago, Armando was our server. He did an outstanding job. He was very fast, never had our table empty, whether it was refills or more appetizers. He really knew his shit. Unfortunately, the plate my husband likes was sold out and Armando suggested a different one, which was really good!! He could slow down a little when he talks, and he would be perfect but, everything was satisfying!  THANKS ARMANDO!

Good food, terrible time management by red headed waitress. Waiting for table at bar and she takes 20 minutes to get them their change after check was dropped off. I don't know how they felt, but I was less than thrilled. 
Both Brio's have one of the best Happy Hours in town, but no space to enjoy it.

Good food, great prices of Happy hours as usual but again disappointed by the service. No smiles, no sincere services by hosts and server. What's wrong with this place?? It was much better before. It's getting worse and worse every time I go there.

Recently we celebrated our Anniversary with Friends at Brio Tuscan Grille. The service was very good along with the terrific Italian cuisine; grilled salmon, mouth watering grilled pork chop (bone in); savory lobster and shrimp linguini, delicious veal scallopini and more. Our waiter refilled our water every 10-15 minutes, or as needed.

We are definitely coming back.
I have to say this place gets ALL FIVE STARS!  Delicious!  I've eaten at a lot of places in Las Vegas and Food is good, service is great (in particular our waiter Justin), everything is top notch.

My wife and I have been to Brio in Tivoli Village and Town Square for happy hour, lunch and dinner many times over the yrs, sometime with our friends, too, and always have good experiences. 

This evening my wife and I went for an early dinner. The pleasant hostess took us to a nice and quiet corner table. The dining room was not crowded, yet, so was pretty quiet, although the bar area was hopping, as the patio was a bit too cold, even for the tough young crowd. Our server, Kim, was very friendly and helpful, and got our beer orders (Blue Moon, $5.25) started immediately. Good thing she did that for us, too, because the barkeeps were kept super busy by those happy yuppies, who "never seem to have to work!"  Boy do I envy them!  ;-)  
The wait staff quickly brought us our favorite bread basket with warm and delicious rolls, which we enjoyed over our beers. And I started feeling great!

BTW: Brio's STILL  DON'T serve Blue Moon on DRAFT, yet, only in a bottle! SIGH! 

For dinner, my wife ordered the "Sliced steak salad" (15.95), and I had the "Mediteranian shrimps" (15.95). Both were delicious! The steak was tender and juicy and in good quanty; shrimps were cruchy fresh and very tasty! Their presentations were quite appetizing - I totally forgot to take any pics of our dishes, being distracted by our hunger and discusions on our travel plans for 2014! Trust me, our dinners looked good! 

Our sweet server Kim (no, she is NOT Korean) was attentive and pleasant; her crew was efficient, keeping our water glasses full, and putting our finished dishes discreetly away. Kim also did us a great favor, taking the time to straighten out the mistakes with my Brio's reward account and honored my $15 reward credits - very nice of her!

During our dinner, the hostess (perhaps also mgr) came by to say hello, and later helped the waitress out with our check. [i.e., taking it to/from the cashier, but NO, she did NOT really help out with the $Check, You Silly!]  ;-)   - A nice business practice! 

The Brio brand is characterized by its reliable, good italian style cuisine of VALUE; spaciousness, comfy ambience; vibrant bar scene; excellent service. Hmm...table cloths also add a touch of elegance. Of course there are other comparable restaurants, but I think Brio stands out in ITS CLASS. 
- My friends say, it's like dining in a "Mid-Upscale" restaurant at Olive Garden prices. 

For me, the Brio's in general and this locale in particular is one of the places I would go on a whim for happy hour (their $4 tasty small plates, Wed Martinis...are hard to resist at times) and/or for a tasty meal - NO SURPRISES!

Jan 2014
Lunch at Brios - Our 3 plates were a TRIFECTA of PERFECTION. My Steak Salad was great! Service was A+ too. Highly Recommend Brios. Enjoy =)

There is a thin line between taste and haste I rarely get to Summerlin met a friend at Brio we ordered the chicken limone Got Served the pesce Piccata decided to just roll with it... the presentation was delightful the dish was so uninspired even after asking for crushed Chili Peppers short of dumping Himalayan salt fresh ground pepper maybe a bit of garlic or something on it I just found it the most bland dish I have had in ages

Brio's Happy Hour is getting worse and worse.  I would have given Brio a strong 3 stars or a week 4 months ago.  

I still think their Sunday Brunch is solid and the dinner options are fine.  There are certainly better options out there for both.  Their wine list has always been stale and conventional.

The most disappointing thing is their changing quality and quantity of HH items.  HH was the best thing they had going for them.  The first month that their Happy Hour was going the portions were much larger and it seemed as if more care was taken...when their burger was first added it was great for the price.  The patty has changed and it is now a crappy burger covered up in a good I-N-O style burger spread.

solid food, great salads, good service.  comfortable and pleasant setting.. good bang for the buck.  what else do you want?  hot sourdough bread?  they have that too..  super nom nom.     the summerlin location is def mellower than the Town Square location.

Loved our food but what made the date night special was Meagan!  We asked her opinion on all of our choices & she was spot on each time.  She even recognized that my 2nd Cucumber/Basil Gimlet looked wrong but had me try it before taking it back.
She made our once another outing great.
The food oh yeah the food was fantastic!  Pasta Pesto was so light & perfect for a hot night & my hubby's was heavier, beef & pappardelle but oh so yummy.
Thanks Brio for making our evening away from a toddler so awesome!

Excellent food, and an even better happy hour with dishes starting at $3.95, great place to come in a group and share there happy hour tapas. I enjoyed the spinach artichoke dip and the black pepper shrimp. We had a great server, Justin, great customer service! And to top it all off, the tiramisu... Words cant explain how delicious it was. It is very affordable during happy hour however the regular menu is a bit more pricy
Went here for afternoon drinks and appetizers. Our server Andy was super nice! The outdoor atmosphere was perfect for a beautiful Saturday afternoon. Both the food and peach bellinis were delicious!
Food was great. A romantic place to go on a date.

I take clients here because it's a place I can always rely on. The food is consistently fresh and expertly-prepared, with a professional and gracious staff, and an outstanding interior and atmosphere.

I love this place. I love the lobster bisque!! It was delicious, I often think about it. I've loved everything I've ever ordered... The steak, the mahi mahi, the vegetarian ravioli, and dessert. Must. Order. Dessert! Get the sampler, the whole sampler. Yum

This is my favorite happy hour in all of Vegas! $5 drink specials and several food items for $2.95!! And it tastes good! I've been here more times than I can count and keep coming back. The outdoor seating area is limited so you may have to wait for a seat.. the seating is better at the location in town square.

Sat at the bar last night and had an exceptional experience. The food was outstanding and the service even better. The little blonde bartender customized martinis for both my husband and I and they were amazing. We had the Shrimp and Eggplant appetizer since the bartender suggested it so highly and it was the best item i have ever tried at Brio. Finally a place in Summerlin with great service, food and drink. Truly the total package. 5 stars to Brio in Tivoli Village!

Though we live pretty close to Tivoli, this was our first visit to Brio for dinner.  Our last attempt was for Happy Hour a year ago, but we bailed when we were directed to sit on the side of the patio in which every seat was in full sun -- and it was 112° outside!  Happily, though the temp was five degrees hotter tonight, we ate in air-conditioned comfort.

We were with friends who are soon-to-be locals (if the husband ever gets his way), and our waitress, whose name I unfortunately don't remember, was extremely attentive and efficient throughout the meal.

For starters, we ordered the Bruschetta Sampler platter.  None of us realized until we were biting into different tastes that it was made up of all the different bruschettas they offered.  Some had prosciutto, some broiled tomato, and some were heavy on the balsamic (this is a good thing).  We enjoyed it a lot.  We also liked the Spinach and Artichoke dip, with the crunchy triangles of flatbread that accompanied it.  

Brio tends to have a Mediterranean flair that tries to up it a notch from straight Italian, but for me this wasn't a plus.  I do love the food at Mediterranean restaurants, and am also a fan of Greek cuisine, but I'm not keen on feta cheese.  While trying to decide on an entree, almost everything I wanted to order had feta.  Happily, I was able to substitute gorgonzola in the Mediterranean Shrimp dish I settled on.  I could have also changed it to parmesan.  Four nicely-broiled shrimp sat atop a delicious melange of orzo, farro, broccoli, and artichokes.  I haven't had farro before (though I have a package of it in my pantry waiting for me to cook), and I liked the nuttiness that it added to the mixture.  If I hadn't already been full from the appetizers, I might have thought that there should have been one more shrimp on the plate.  Then again, it was 14.95, the shrimp were meaty, and I was stuffed before I started.

Two others ordered Chicken Milanese, and the third had Filet Mignon, which came with veggies and his choice of crisply roasted potatoes instead of the mashed it came with.  I didn't taste them, but they looked like a small version of potato skins without all the toppings, and he really liked them.  The Chicken Milanese was covered with mozzarella, which is unusual.  Add some red sauce and they would have had chicken parm.  That was served with a side of linguine in a plain tomato sauce.  The chicken was reported to be tender and perfectly cooked.

We shared a bottle of California Riesling; I think it was Wente, and wasn't overly sweet or dry, just right.  My only nit was the bread, because the dense bread with the hard crust that I love turned out to be sourdough.  I don't like sourdough, but others will disagree with me.  Other than that, it was a very enjoyable meal.  And we'll try Happy Hour again if the heat wave ever breaks.  Like in October  :)
Happy hour food and drinks are amazing! Great prices! Shrimp tasty and dirty martinis all night long

Food has never failed on my visits to Brio. Since we had such a rainy day yesterday I craved non other than than their famous Lobster Bisque-a harvest colored creamy goodness in a cup. I always order this and so should you.

Sauvignon Blanc was crisp and cold, warm sourdough bread basket was a perfect compliment. We shared some Caprese-sliced buffalo chunky tomatoes, olive oil, drops of balsamic vinegar and arugula was fresh and a perfect start.  

The hubby can't resist a wedge salad and I can't resist trying it. The creamy blue-cheese dressing was mild and the big slice of ice-burg was covered in bacon bits, tomatoes and onion. MMM.

Service was friendly and atmosphere always lovely.  I'll be back.

Had our friends birthday dinner here the other night and it was great. Fast service. Food was delicious. Anthony was our server and my wife and I ordered the salmon salad to share and he came out with it already split for us. Our water was refilled every time we got half way empty. Thanks for the great service Anthony! Definitely recommend this place.

I am constantly surprised with how much we enjoy our time, food, drinks, and the staff at Brio.  Whereas most chains fall short in the personality department, the bar crew here is supreme.  Mandy, Kelly, Jim and all of the rest of the team know how to hustle and entertain while keeping the cocktails and delicious cuisine flowing.
We started coming here for the unbeatable $3.95 happy hour menu (3-6:30 and 9-close weekdays) , but now it has become high on our go-to list of places to feel amongst friends.

No need to fully gorge on their menu... the flatbreads are excellent enough if are in for a light lunch with a glass of wine. Conducive enough for a group of friends who are more attuned to catching up than gorging.... best thing is they don't rush you to eat your food.
This is an awesome happy hour spot.  Food and service were good.  Sit out on the patio.  Order flat bread and eggplant fries, yummy!

Ask for Gus! He's a great server. He was so friendly and very attentive. 

My roommate and I decided to come here on a Thursday night after a long day of work. We had to wait about 10 mins to be seated. But once we were seated, we were greeted right away by Gus. We ordered: the spaghetti bolognese, beef carpaccio, caprese salad, lobster bisque soup, and calamari.

The spaghetti bolognese was so creamy! It was amazing. The beef carpaccio is ALWAYS on point. So flavorful. The caprese salad was... eh, nothing special. The lobster bisque soup was some of the best soup I have ever had, to be completely honest. And the calamari was nothing short of yum. For dessert we got the chocolate cake with a side of vanilla gelato. It was okay, nothing spectacular. But I'll definitely be back for the beef carpaccio and lobster bisque!

My mom and my sis and I came here on New Years Day for brunch.  Although, the place was pretty busy, our server was very friendly.  Our food came out a little slow and we didn't order anything complicated.  I had their grilled salmon, which was cooked to perfection - delicate and moist.  My sister and I also ordered their Bloody Maryl, which was also very good. We really enjoyed our visit here.  Hopefully, Tivoli Village will fill up soon to bring more people to Brio and the other restaurants.  Right now, there's really no shops to go to around there.

First time in, food is very good, staff is very friendly, I would give it a 5-star but, they need a little more assistance with the food servers. Even though our server was very nice and very helpful, you can tell that she was rushed, Not stressed, just rushed. She needed some assistance which I didn't see anybody else helping her. Besides that, I would highly recommended for a very good experience in dining.

i went here will not go back. went with a party of 12. really lousy servixe i ordered veal parmesan it was greasy taisted bad was really a thin slice and the sause taisted canned. we also order seafood fettuccine and it taisted good but  uhhhh where was the seafood? also when i asked the waitress why she kept walking away and not take my order. she said because she didnt like me.
Excellent service. Our server was amazing. This is my favorite place when I'm craving Italian. So many choices, and I love that they have dessert shots. I highly recommend this place!

Nice atmosphere, upscale decor in Tivoli. Friendly but disjointed service. Our salads arrived but mine didn't.  Was pleasantly surprised by the Bistecca Insalata, crisp fresh greens with the right amount dressing when it finally arrived. My Veal Milanese was a big disappointment, tasted oily and reheated, the angel hair pasta was dry and the veg were either under cooked or dried out and wrinkled. The caper wine sauce was almost nonexistent. 
The other 5 in our party were satisfied and enjoyed their meal.

My fella took me here on an afternoon we both had off for a nice much  Their bread basket is delicious and fresh!!!I ordered the soup and salad combo with Field Greens Salad and Lobster Bisque....delicious! He ordered the pasta and egg plant off the lunch menu...also too darn tastey to describe! The hostess lacked personality and looked a bit put off and uninterested in being friendly with guests. (Although she did seem chummy with tithed staff.)  Our waitress was super friendly and stayed on top of our iced teas.  We enjoyed our experience and will likely return.

Came on a Monday and had to wait 20 minutes. After waiting, walked inside and half the restaurant was empty. 

After being seated and ordering, we waited 40 minutes for our food. When I asked how much longer our food would take she said "it takes 15-18 minutes to make your food" in a very snarky tone. 

When the food came out the steak was cold and the salad was soggy like it had been plated and left too long. The 2 pasta dishes we ordered were fine. 

In years of dining out, I've never had to speak to the manager of a restaurant to complain about service. The manager wasn't very helpful either and said she would check with us to make sure everything was ok but never saw her again.  The restaurant was obviously understaffed and mismanaged.

Literally had such an amazing server Gus!!! Went in on the 4th of July! We had happy hour right before it was over and he was awesome!! All of our drinks continued to be filled!! I never get such awesome service and as a server myself I am extremely picky! I live in Henderson so about 30 away from here but would come back for him!!!


Thanks;)

We were so excited to have Brio come to Summerlin.  We decided to give it a shot and thought we would have to wait for seating.  We were very pleased we did not have to wait long at all.  We were impressed with the menu selection and had heard many great things.  This set our expectation high.  The food was good we ordered steak and pasta.  The service however was lacking.  Our water glasses were not checked and we were seated right next to the kitchen.  The manager was on her cell phone in the open kitchen having an emotional conversation and the staff did not appear to help each other out.  One of the waitresses was crying and two appeared to be angry at each other.  We highly value service and on our visit it was lacking.  By the end of the meal we were discussing that we would have enjoyed a meal at Carrabbas more.  It may have just been the evening we decided to go and we have discussed giving Brio another try, it wasn't bad but it was only OK and we were hoping for WOW!

Ummm... Five stars for Brio's happy hour, am I taking crazy pills?!

It feels odd, but I must have hit this place at the right time because the service was incredibly fast, the food was beyond expectations, and the price was stellar, $3.95 for a Margherita flatbread pizza? I'm in!

I came here after working an event, just looking for a quick snack before hitting the long road back to Henderson. I bellied up to the bar and almost fell off my chair when I peeked at the menu saw the prices; the most expensive item was the Brio Burger for $6. I didn't order this, but instead went with Black Pepper Shrimp, Beef Carpaccio, Tuscan Tots and a Margherita Flatbread. 

Everything was very good, but the Black Pepper Shrimp was the winner of the meal. Seared Romano crusted eggplant with seared shrimp on top and some insane cream sauce, definitely not a low calorie option, but worth totally worth it. The beef Carpaccio is must order, it wasn't too fatty and cut paper thin it will literally melt in your mouth. 

The Tuscan Tots were sneaky. I was thinking these would be your basic tater tots, but they are small mashed potato balls that are coated in breadcrumbs and filled with bacon, mozzarella cheese and fried, I'm done. The Flatbread pizza was great, covered in fresh veggies and flavorful basil, but compared to everything else it was probably least favorite out of the bunch, but still worth ordering.  

The price point was the best part of the whole meal, with two cocktails each and with all the food mentioned prior, our tab didn't break $40. 

Happy Hour goes from 3:30 - 6:30pm and then again from 8pm to close. Great atmosphere, no smoking and great food.... duh, I'll be back for sure!

I feel I have given Tivoli Village long enough to get their shit straight. I don't know if the cost of rent in this place is so low it invites the kind of "who cares if it fails" culinary experimentation, or if it is so high restaurants are forced to try and sell you crap at a premium. 

As an outside observer, it would seem as if Brio Tuscan Grille is the only restaurant that has managed to survive the Tivoli Village curse. Unfortunately, its mere survival does not preclude the fact that the restaurant as a whole is, well just blah. One look at the main photo on its Yelp page speaks volumes, the burger looks like something I would expect at my third cousin's "backyard birthday bonanza" for her 6 year old - they even cut it up in sections for the kiddies.

The food is not bad, and quite honestly I am impressed with the portion size of their appetizers, as they simply whet your appetite, not drown it. The unfortunate part is that the appetizers are only good if they are half off during happy-hour - I can't imagine paying full price for that. Which leads us to the rest of the menu, where the price points are where you would expect them to be if you were dining on the Strip. Not that I don't have great hope that Tivoli eventually becomes a great dining destination worthy of the high-dolar restaurants, but if it is Friday night and your place is half empty - well I'm just saying.

The service itself was okay, but one doesn't feel an abundance of warmth from the staff. Don't get me wrong, they did everything right and in a timely manner, it's just that there was no warmth there.

I won't go as far as to say that Brio Tuscan Grille is a disappointment, I just can't imagine waiting in line for this place, which is probably why there isn't one.

This place was surprisingly delicious. I have to say there was hesitancy when we walked up to the front door and couldn't see anyone at all. However, after the hostess led us into the main dining area the place lit up. Delicious appetizers and a pretty amazing chefs special. Would def recommend this joint!!

Brio is amazing hands down but the service is what really puts any restaurant over the top. I've never received such amazing genuine service from everyone that works at a restaurant. I sat at the bar this time and Terri was the bartender. If you ever have the chance to interact with her consider yourself lucky. She is so full of energy, fun, and attentive. She became very busy the day I was there but she always checked on me to make sure I had everything I needed or wanted. She's funny and all around a good genuine person. Every server that passed by me always asked how I was doing and how my food was. Jessie one of the managers is the cherry on top of amazing service. He is always cool calm and collected and I see him running around with the servers helping them out. He's a genuine guy who cares about the way his restaurant is ran. If you're looking for good food and GREAT service this is the place to be!!!

Service top notch!
The food was right on point!
App's were fast and delicious.

Live music added so much!!

I normally go to the Brio in Town Square as it is closer to where I live; however, I was on this side of town and decided to come to this location with a friend. It was setup very nicely, although I prefer the look and setup in Town Square (Thats just personal preference). The food was delicious as always and the staff was there to service, very friendly! 

The staff did seem a little "on edge" and checking everything, but that is okay by me! I also think they were like that because it opened very recently, so they are still getting into the routine. Regardless, simply wonderful! I am sure with time this location will be just as popular as the Town Square location.

This was a fun last-minute lunch place that I and a few friends visited this weekend. I had heard about the place but had never been there. WIth this being the first day to really feel like summer (well, summer in Ohio, where I'm from) I really enjoyed sitting outside and enjoying the sunshine, the breeze and the passers by (including Carrot Top, who said hi as he ambled by). The atmosphere was fun and casual- I really liked the view of the outdoor section where diners sit separated from the sidewalks of Tivoli Village by an attractively scalloped, metal "fence."  Aluminum-colored heating elements spaced throughout the outdoor area looked sculptural and artsy.  Large umbrellas protected patrons from the bright, hot sun.  Our waiter, Brian, had a great personality and made the experience even more enjoyable..

I had the risotto with chicken and the tossed salad for about $14.00. It was tasty, but I liked my friend's shrimp version better.  The crusty bread served before the meal was quite enjoyable.  A couple of us had the wedge salad, which was accompanied by a gorgonzola and garlic dressing that, in my opinion, was light and not overpowering. My friends loved that it had bacon.

I would definitely come here again and bring family or friends. Now I want to see what it looks like inside!

I love the little shopping center in Tivoli Village.  Patio seating, bar, and regular dining is offered.  I came here expecting Italian food (my usual is the lobster & shrimp ravioli) but went with the 5 oz. filet instead.  It was cooked perfectly - honestly one of the best steaks I've had!
