This restaurant is always crowded, which is strange since the food is just ok. Of you are looking for Italian, there are a lot better places to go than here.

I've been twice . Happy hour in the bar was great, drinks and apps prices great! They pour good liquor and it was fun...visit 2 for dinner. Service was good , food was ok, atmosphere ok too. However the prices for this food is ridiculous, it's very clear that the rent is so high they have no choice! I don't mind paying for a good meal, if it's really good. Sorry N O R As  smokes this place on the Italian food, why go anywhere else

Came here with my wife for our anniversary and were pleasantly surprised. The food is excellent. I got the crabcakes (crab and shrimp) and they were awesome. My wife got a chicken dish where the chicken was breaded and skewered over mashed potatoes (don't know the name of the dish) and it was a ton of food.

My only complaint, but it was a minor one due to a pet peeve of mine is that our server seemed a little aloof. Never around when I actually wanted him to be. Not sure where he was since the kitchen area is all open so you can you the server's stations, etc. I think we could have been out of their 10-15 minutes sooner had he been around. It wasn't just at the end of our meal, but also during. Seemed kind of weird for the type of establishment. I still give it 4 stars and will for sure try it again, but may have to change my rating if I end up having a similar experience.

Delicious food, great portions and kid friendly. I always order the Mahi mahi or whatever seafood dish they are offering. Waitstaff are wonderful and attentive. 4 out of 5 stars for the hostesses. Ive gone in quite a few times and its always teenage girls standing there talking to each other, offer me no smile or greeting upon entering or leaving. Had a nice talk with the manager that was more than open to hearing me out and agreeing there is a problem. I will be back for the delish food for sure =)
Great lunch at brio! Get the quino and chicken salad and skip the fruti de Mara. Really nice atmosphere
Love this place.  Me and my BF visit almost weekly.  The service, ambiance and food is always excellent. One of our favorite dishes is the Brio salad...   Yum.

Tivoli Village location has horrible service. That alone made this place so terribly annoying. I have eaten at Brio all across the U.S. because its consistently good food and service. Not this location unfortunately. 

Waiter took 20 min to acknowledge us. Was nowhere to be found during the meal and filled our glasses once. I had to get up and look for the guy in the front of the kitchen to get him to come back to our table. And to top it off my $20 plate of Chicken Limone was nothing more than chicken on pasta. Missing the lemon completely on taste and only present in presentation. 

I should have ordered what I normally order but I was feeling adventurous. I live in this neighborhood and am here daily so I expect to come back and have better service. You need to if you are going to stay afloat in Tivoli.


I'll revisit and update, hopefully with better news.

Went there with a friend last night for dinner during happy hour. Had the Brio Burger, Garlic Spinach Artichoke Dip, & The Flatbread with tomatoes/cheese and it was delicious! Some of the items during happy hour like the brio burger are not available at other times - just an fyi. The staff are friendly and overall nice ambiance. I'd definitely come back again. Thank you!

So sad! We wanted to love this place! Went for brunch and had the most annoying server... Finally ordered (we couldn't make up
Our minds) and I opted to start with a salad and artichoke dip. Dip was okay. Nothing special. I'd love to mention the salad but it never came. Got the spicy chicken bacon sandwich. BEWARE it tastes like chipotle sauce and mayonnaise only! It was the most awkward tasting item is ever had before! French toast was underwhelming as well. Very tart with some gross lemon filling. But the fruit and syrup were delicious. Which we had to ask for syrup from three different people. Bc we were still hungry we ordered a side of scrambled eggs... Which took twenty minutes to arrive. Then I had to go to the bar for ketchup. It was just an overall poor experience. We wanted to love this place. The patio is very nice to enjoy! We had a great time people watching!

Got to try this place because while in Vegas - we met up with family and they recommended this place to meet up and I am SO GLAD they did!

I had their Brio Sliced Steak Salad - This was SO GOOD and I LOVED it.  The salad had tender slices of steak with a chopped salad that had a delicious balsamic dressing along with tomatoes, gargonzola, mushrooms, spicy pecans and I think there was a bit of creamy horseradish that gave it that perfect BITE with the steak!! Wish they had this dish at home! 

We also had the special which was the Seared Scallops with Risotto - I think my hubby pretty much inhaled this dish and the plate licked clean!  Other family members had the Lobster and Risotto!  The TAIL was HUGE - they LOVED it and each of the risottos were paired with wine which went perfectly with each of the dishes!

We were so stuffed we couldn't eat dessert but i have to tell you - the food, service, atmosphere was PERFECT! We sat around and enjoyed our meal and company with water glasses getting filled and just great service all around.

I actually wish we had a Brio Tuscan Grille in the bay area but at least now we know a go to place when in Vegas!!
This location is 10x times better than Town Square. Plus we had an amazing waitress. Good job and keep it up!

Dropped in for a snack at the bar and staff was very attentive and engaging.  I've got a goofy food allergy/sensitivity and the chef was prompted to come out and work with me on items he'd prepare to avoid said allergy.
Awesome.

Arctic salmon  That's all I gotta say! The food there is great! Nice a fresh and always plated looking good. Unfortunately the service I had at the bar was straight up crap. He got our order after a little bit than didn't even make our cocktail until 25 mins after and poured two waters 15 mins after ordering. The food took a listle while to come out as well. He didn't ask or check up on us really at all until the very end of the meal whitch when i had the plates stacked in front of me. We would definitely come back and give it another shot maybe this time at a dining table.

Love this place, something nice for summerlin.  This is a great  restaurant for birthdays, date nights, dinner with my friends etc.  Great service above average for price point in fact.  It is often crowded but always seem to get a seat with no wait unless I'm with a group. Love the mints when you leave.  I have been getting the Shrimp Verdutta which I can't eat all at once but always take home and eat the next day too.  SO good.  I easily would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a nice dinner not over priced.  Just took my parents here in fact.

My family and I were celebrating my mother in laws birthday, when a pigeon that had gotten into the restaurant pooped on my sister in law!  It did it twice; the first time we thought someone had flipped sauce on her, and three of us helped her get it out of her hair.  The second time, we looked around and noticed the bird above her head.  The staff was disgustingly unprofessional, insulted us with a 20 dollar gift card after we spent 500 dollars on food (that's not even enough to go back and have the meal paid for!!), the waiters and waitresses laughed, told other guests, swore, and mocked our family.  Your staff implying that a filthy disease ridden animal defecating on guests near the kitchen of your restaurant is out of the company's policy to make things right makes me shudder to think what else you would not help on.  I've had better customer service in every single other restaurant I've ever attended.  To make matters worse, when posting complaints on your Facebook wall, after talking to my sister in law who ever manages that account LIED and said she was fine with how things were handled!  Your customer service is disgusting and as we now see on more than just your one restaurants standard.  We are a family of 20 adults with in laws, 30 grandchildren and have been established in Las Vegas.  Your lack of class and neglegance has lost all of our business and all of extended family and friends business.

Meh. Chain restaurant... 'nuff said.  8/6 visit.  None of the food was that good - I ordered the Balsamic Braised Beef Short Rib which was under-seasoned, bland and absent much flavor (er... saaaay Balsamic vinegar!?); my daughter ordered Pasta Alla Vodka which was slightly better.  Substantial portions, neither was worth taking home as left-overs.

The wine pour was mediocre.

Appitizer of Artichoke Dip was the star of the show; dessert of Dolchino Trio was great.

Server was friendly enough, but service sucked (disappearing for long periods of time; needing to be reminded of our requests numberous times - frankly I think he may have just had too many tables, despite the nearly 7p seating and a 1/3 full restaurant).

Hostess was wonderful, both being on the ball once we arrived; stewarding a late arrival back to our table; offering to charge my phone at the front when I was looking for an oulet.

Bigger price for an Olive Garden experience.

The service is great and the food even better. I am not a huge pasta fan, but this restaurant converts me into one while I am there. :) I have eaten here for lunch and dinner multiple times and have never been disappointed. 

I would recommend a menu item, but I don't think you can go wrong with anything you pick!

Maybe we just got a bad night ,but the food was not that good very salty. I gave a 2 star for the service the waiter was outstanding. The prices were very high for what you got. Definitely better Italian food restaurants in Summerlin.

The Brio  (location #2 west of the strip), is a new favorite stop when we come to Las Vegas. Service was outstanding, our wait staff highly informed and knowledgeable about all the menu items. We were there with a group of 10 and the service didn't suffer at all.  I couldn't recommend this restaurant higher.  Can't wait for my next visit...

We went to Brio at Tivoli Village last night to celebrate my father in law's 60th birthday. I wish I could remember our server's name because she made the night (white, dark blonde hair pulled back, funny)! 

The food was great. 2 of us got the gargonzola crusted beef medallions. YUM! One got tortellini and one got the gargonzola crusted lamb chops. We also had calamari and caesar salads for appetizers. All food was great. We had cocktails and then got a bottle of wine. The wine selection never disappoints. Toward the end of dinner, they brought out creme brulee with a candle for the bday boy which was nice. The table ordered dessert drinks (I had an amazing port wine!). 

So why only 3 stars? We loved the service and the food. The problem was the fire alarm. It went off not once but twice during dinner. So loud thay everyone was plugging their ears. Strobe lights flashing. It took a very long time for it to stop each time. I understand that this might be out of the restaurants control, but they could have done something to appease the few tables of people in the restaurant. After the first alarm, a manager walked around apologizing. After the second, nothing. There weren't many people in the restaurant at 9:30 so it would have been a nice gesture to at least offer a drink on the house or something. No more apologies or compensation. It just seems a little unprofessional when we're spending $300 and had to sit through alarms twice. 

If you can go and avoid the alarm (or don't mind them not caring if it ruins your dinner), everything else is great!

I liked the Town Square location the one or two times I was there. But the food I got at the Tivoli location was mediocre at best. The sweet potato and chicken risotto ($16.25) was gummy and tasted like paste. The fettuccine napoli ($15.95) was better, but nothing stellar. The best thing I tried was the kid's cheese pizza. Yeah, that means the place is kid friendly. The prices are reasonable -- although from what I hear happy hour is the best time to go since apps are $3 each.

Sorry, but even though the food and service is fine, their lack of knowledge and information for this year's Lasagna Day was not. 

In the past, lasagna day was half off their lasagna dish. I called a week ahead to see if this was still true and made reservations when the person on the phone said it was. One week later, we get there and sit down and order. The waiter didn't know about this at all, or what the special was. Before he took our orders, the salads that came with the lasagna were included. And yet after we got the check and I asked about the discount, he said the manager said that the salads were what were given for free. 

Unless they come out with better and more clear announcements so that everyone is on board, not four different people thinking different things, I'll have to cancel the lasagna anniversary. =(

Went for dinner with my bestie n had great time. Food was delicious! We Had my favorite beef carpaccio as appetizer. My entree was shrimp & lobster pasta which was so yummy!! Service was good n the place wasn't crowded this time. Dinner was very yummy as usual.

Food is great, but the service needs attention. The waitress (am I allowed to use that term since it's gender-specific?) was very friendly. Unfortunately after she took the order, she returned much later to ask if we would like dessert. I guess what happens between the initial order and the time they are ready to clear the table for the next party does not matter much. The guy who actually delivers the lunch was ill-prepared to serve us because the table was covered with dirty dishes from the appetizer round. Hello? Clear the table and then bring the meal. Got busboys? Use them. It also never pays to respond to the typical question, "Is there anything else you need?" because you never get what you need. A simple request for red pepper flakes, which should be within reach of every table in an Italian restaurant, was completely ignored. I guess he had other things to do such as deliver water to each new customer regardless whether the water is requested or not. (I thought there was a water shortage in this town. Never mind....) Considering the location (Tivoli Village, the "Rodeo Drive" of Summerlin) the service was at best cordial, but hectic. Maybe adding more staff during the Christmas season, as many offices are having their office parties these days, would be helpful. I am sure we will be back, as I say for the great food, but dear friends, bring your own red pepper flakes if you like your food spicy.

I'll save you time having to read the rest of this review with this right here:

Good food
Small portions
Big forks

If you want to continue...this place is pretty tasty and for franchised Italian I'd place it above Carraba's and way above the Italian Denny's they call the Olive Garden.

So why 3 stars?

I felt the portions were really small compared to what I can get at a mom and pop Italian joint...perhaps two ravioli entrees for one person would have been sufficient. Also, although the flavor was excellent, I found the sauce accompanying the lobster and shrimp dish a little watery, but the shrimp on top of the raviolis were cooked perfectly. My date liked her Ravioli alla vodka but felt it was small for a dinner portion.

Also the warm bread wasn't bad but wasn't anything amazing and the butter wasn't soft...and the atmosphere is a little dark, but I guess that's what they're going for.

On a bright note, the food came out fast, the waiter was attentive and I went during "Ravioli Week" so the 50% off was a great deal...had I walked out hungry paying the normal price of $55 (tax+tip) for two small ravioli dishes I'd have felt ripped.

Did I mention I like their big forks?

My husband and I decided to sit at the bar today because we didn't have the kids and it made our experience so amazing! Bri was one of the beat bartenders in Vegas we have ever had the pleasure to meet. Thank you bri for turning around our opinion on service here!!!! We will definitely be back just to spend time with her and indulge in the delicious food! To top it off we ran into Alyssa who was an amazing server in another restaurant months ago. Good job Brio for hiring experienced personable servers and bartenders it makes the difference especially when we only have a couple hours alone!!!!

LOVED THIS PLACE! My girlfriend and I were really bored one night and were driving around and just spontaneously decided to come here for dinner... 

We were seated right away and we were able to pick our table we wanted outside. They were very nice and accommodating. Our waiter he was really nice however I think he was a little overwhelmed that night.. we got forgotten about a couple times, but seriously the food made up for it 100 percent. 

I ordered a Mango Sangria and ohh let me tell you how tasty that was! Best Sangria I think I have ever had. 

Definitely worth checking out. For a chain this place was awesome. The food was outstanding our calamari was cooked perfectly.. I hate when it comes out rubbery. Their caesar salad is so amazing as well as their Pepperoni and Sausage Flatbread... just writing this review is making me crave the flatbread again..

We really enjoyed happy hour here. The Sangria was excellent and would highly recommend it. The pricing for the happy hour really makes it a worthwhile stop.  However, I did not like the spinach and artichoke dip.  The rest of the appetizers were decent.  Overall the restaurant is much better than the happy hour at the bar, but the price is right to hang out, have a Sangria, and a few appetizers.

Went during happy hour, which was totally loud and busy!  We got the last bar table.  It took a little while but finally someone took our drink and food order.  They forgot one of the apps, so we had to ask the waitress.  We also had to ask her repeatedly for refills.  Other than the waitress and staff who need a  bit more training in customer service, we thought the food was very good (vegs and hummus, spinach/artichoke dip, shrimp, caprese salad).  There are pita chips with everything, I'd like to see them offer something that's gluten free.  Overall, a good experience.

Spent last Saturday cruising the Tivoli Village Farmer's Market and once we'd loaded up on Kettle corn and asparagus, we decided to grab a bite to eat.  Having dined at the Brio in Town Square, and enjoyed it several times, we decided to give this location a go.

The patio was lovely at 11am on a Saturday. We managed to get there before the rush, so we had our pick of seats and it was quiet and very relaxing. 

Our server wasn't the best in the world. He was a tall slim guy (though all the servers seemed to be super tall and slim) with a huge band-aid on the side of his neck. I assume this was to cover some kind of tattoo, but it wasn't that appetizing, i'll be honest.

However, because he was so soft spoken and meek, I thought maybe he had some kind of life-saving throat or neck surgery and cut him some slack.  His service was super slow and he forgot about us a few times, but I refused to let it ruin the brunch and let Mr. Potential Cancerous Goiter and/or Criss Angel Tattoo off without griping.

The peach bellini is TO DIE for. So good and comes in a giant pint glass. I thought it was going to be a simple bellini in a champagne flute, but no, this was like a booze slurpee. For $7. I'll have two next time.

I had the eggs benedict, which was absolutely delicious. The grilled asparagus that came with it was gone in 30 seconds. I like my poached eggs on the medium-well side and mine came so runny they were almost cold inside (which I realize is how some folks like them). But the manager, who happened to be walking by, had them remake them, despite my protests. She was really attentive and personable. I should've gotten her name -- she's got long dark hair and blue eyes, kinda on the wee side.

I'd definitely go back to this location, especially  for brunch. There's some berry stuffed french toast I've got my eye on...

I love the food and drinks here but the bar back showed more attentiveness and better customer service than my bartender Jennifer did. She took my drink and food order quickly but never followed up with me. She was working hard to help others but didn't give me the time of the day, for some reason. Customer service is much better at the Town Square location. Not once in an hour and a half did she ask me if I needed anything.

Saturday, Brunch. Outside. Mojitos. Perfect. Service was great. Not too pushy to get us out of there. (they were busy) I hadn't tried this part of the the menu before and wasn't excited about it but the omlet was just fine. I usually eat the crab cakes at the location at Town Cener. But, the service there has gone downhill. It's like McDonalds Ronalds playland when you sit outside there. It sucks. You try and have a great meal and surrounding you is kids crying and running. Yes, I said running, around you. Nobody seems to notice ? I told the server I wouldn't be back since that was the 2nd dinner I had that experience. Apparently is not just a family restaurant,it's kiddie land....So, stick to the location on Rampart, so far, they haven't gone downhill...

Went there when I was in a hurry. Told the front lady and the waiter. They were all really accommodating and I was in-n-out in 30mins ( I ate at Brio instead of taking out). Food was delicious and I love their bread. Will definitely go again!!

My girlfriend and I finally had the day off from our crazy busy schedules and decided to hit Brio for happy hour. Decided to go to Tivoli Brio because townsquare is always so busy. Came in at 4pm, sat at at bar table, not busy at all. Server, no name was said, zero personality, and walks away before I finish talking. Not sure if he was having a day or was offended we ordered happy hour. Even though we ordered all but one app on the menu and cocktails. Food was so so and service was a complete fail. The 3 stars is for the spin dip and sangria. And the servers name was Clifford. Only knew this because of looking on my check. I'll continue my business at townsquare Brio from now on.

Customer service is horrible here. The server had an attitude like they didn't want to be there. The food was bland, the soup was warm. Bad experience. I read the reviews I guess I probably came at a bad night.

We recently had our wedding reception here.  We are from Los Angeles and had never been to Brio Tuscan Grille so I didn't know what to expect.  The food was delicious and all my guests keep telling us how good the food was, how beautiful the restaurant was and how the location was perfect and so nice to get off the strip.  Everything went so well from booking to finish.  The staff is so amazing and so accommodating.  I can't thank everyone enough for making our wedding so perfect and easy.  P.S.- We had our reception on the outdoor patio and it is so pretty on its own that you don't need any decorations.  It's perfect.

I've been to the Happy Hour twice in one week!  This is a really great HH, but let me warn you, it's a girly HH.  Because as my husband said, "There's nothing but martinis and mojitos on this damn drink list!"  It's true, 95% of the menu is sugary and girly concoctions, but sometimes I like me a good lemon drop!

Opinions on the drinks:
The drinks are nicely made and tasty and they're all only $5.  My favorite is one of the special ones they have on Wednesdays that is like a lemon drop with basil.  The sangria rosa is better than the white peach sangria.  The strawberry mojito tastes like fresh strawberries.  The red wine is a good, dry one.

Opinions on the food:
This is the money maker right here.  During HH, they have a special food list where everything is $3.95.  My husband and I ordered a hamburger to share.  Wowza, when it came out, it was like the size of a Carl's Jr. burger and it came with homemade potato chips.  What, what, what?  This whole thing is only $4?  And it was a delicious hamburger with melted provolone cheese and a zingy little secret sauce.  The gentleman next to us ordered the spicy crispy shrimp and a sausage flatbread, both of which were also generously sized for the $4 pricetag.  When I went with my friend, we ordered the ravioli caprese.  Very tasty, but it only comes with 3 ravioli.  Come on...you give out a huge burger and chips, but only 3 ravioli?  I was a little disappointed in that.  We also ordered the shrimp and eggplant which has a really nice smoky sauce to it.

It does get crowded during the HH, and sometimes you have to wait a while to get the bartender's attention, but that is what you have to expect when it's a great HH.  My advice: get there around 3:30 so you can find a seat and put an order in before the rush!

Im always excited to go to the Brio at town square because it's fun and full of people. I'm never excited about this Tivoli location and I'm not sure why.  The food is the same and it looks nice. I think it's just the quieter vibe of Tivoli village.
Also once u eat at Brio there isn't much else to do here at Tivoli.
At town square there are so many shops, bars restaurants and the theater to visit.

I have never dined in the restaurant, i've only been here for happy hour in the bar.  I've been here multiple times and i have to say it is an exceptional deal. I've had everything off the happy hour menu and its extremely fresh and still pretty big portions. The only thing I wish was them having a better beer selection, but I can not complain because their food makes up for it.  So stop by after work and enjoy a nice fresh happy hour meal.  3:30-6:30 is the happy hour time!

I like this restaurant but it seems so loud. The couple times I've been here it was always crowded and reaaallllyy loud. I don't necessarily like having dinner at a place where I can't here the person next to me. The food is pretty good and price in my opinion is right. Wish that the restaurant had less of an open design so that the sounds done travel as harshly.

Brio is the perfect place to have that romantic date you've been meaning to have with your significant other.

I went to the Summerlin location for Valentine's Day and was impressed. They take both reservations and walk-ins so lucky for us since we didn't make a reservation. The estimated wait time was 80 minutes? But we actually got in earlier, probably 30 to 40 minutes?

Anyways... We ate outside near a heat lamp which wasn't too bad in today's weather. We ordered calamari as our appetizer which was fine. I mean, it's calamari... Not much else to it. For our entrees, I got the pasta brio which is grilled chicken with rigatoni. My boyfriend got campenelle carbonara which kind of resembled chicken Alfredo. I also got a flirtini - probably won't get that again. It resembled cough syrup to me, but that could just be my taste buds.

All in all, for $67 this was definitely not a bad place for a date. We will probably check out the one in Town Square once the weather gets warmer since they have a fire pit outside.

Happy eatings!
Tivoli Village itself is a prettier side to the Las Vegas area. You can't go wrong :)

We went here last night to try the restaurant and see what the new Tivoli Village was all about.  The complex is beautiful.  There was a live band playing in one one coutyards with people mingling and dancing.  Very cool.  If and when additional phases of this complex are completed, it will be a wonderful destination.

The restaurant carried the theme of the complex, with beautiful flooring, stonework and large spaces.  The vibe, ambience, seating and service were all excellent.  We had a 6:30 p.m. reservation and had to wait 15 minutes for our table, the only drawback to an otherwise perfect evening.

The wine was priced reasonably asnd the beer was ice cold.  We ordered the quartet of brushetta.  It was beautifully plated, visually appealing and delicious.  My wife had the penne alla vodka, which she really enjoyed.  I had the veal Marsala, with a very dark, rich sauce that was a bit too thick for my taste but otherwise excellent.

We look forward to going again.

i was really disappointed at the price for the food we got.  My "spicy" pasta had little flavor.  The pasta itself was mushy.  Hubby got the lobster ravioli, his favorite meal, with a vodka sauce.  Again, no flavor, just mush.  The two starts comes from our server Frederick who was on top of things.  Drinks were always full.  Bread refilled.  He also brought us a free dessert.  The chocolate mousse was wonderful.  I would not go back

This review is for happy hour in the bar only.  If you are lucky enough to grab a table inside or outside before 630 pm you are definitely set to enjoy a budget friendly happy hour.  It was a Wednesday night about 6pm I was lucky enough to grab a table in the bar area.  It was very busy.  There was some weird guy playing a guitar and singing to keep me and my friend entertained while we waited for the table to be cleared and cleaned.  Not sure if this is a regular thing for brio now providing live entertainment but it was the first I have seen. In any case he was ok, not terrible.  Lol. Our waitress I believe it was Monica K. ( at least that's the name on our receipt) was great!  She ended every sentence with..."it's my pleasure".  Even though it was obvious she was slammed, she never lost her cool and never lost her smile.  She came around to let us know last call for happy hour, which was greatly appreciated.  We ended up with three martinis, one spinach and artichoke dip, two brio burgers and one chocolate cake all for $40.87.  What a steal! Especially since the food is great too!  Burgers are juicy. They have a great variety of items on their happy hour food menu.  In addition to a happy hour drink menu, brio offers $5 martinis all day Wednesday's and $5 wines all days Thursday's. Give it a try and check it out. They have a big outdoor patio.  See you there!

I have been to the Tivoli location three times--once on opening day, once last week for lunch, and today for Sunday brunch.  Opening day was pretty good for a first go--service was exceptional (thanks, Justin!), but the food was cold.   Last Wednesday for lunch was excellent all around (Mediterrean salad and mezza chicken, both great).  Today for brunch--food was excellent (pork chop, white chocolate raspberry French toast, and spinach mushroom fritatta), but service (server was John) was sub-par at best.  Lots of servers, bussers, hostesses, etc., but there was a great deal of confusion amongst employees.  Go to the Town Square location until they get the bugs worked out here.

My first time there this meal was one of the worst I have had in a long time my wife ordered a rib eye medium it came out dry over cooked sent it back then it came out ok but for $32 it was not high quality I ordered shrimp and lobster linguine the shrimp did not taste good seemed like they were very poor quality the manager offered a free dessert which I choose the cheesecake to take home so i just tried that wow horrible so I decided to leave this review $75 dollars later so many other places better could have went to Flemings for $20 more or Cheesecake Factory for less

Before we set foot in Brio, valet is quick and friendly to park my car.

The decor in this place is awesome. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. And the food? I've never had a bad meal. The risotto and Ravioli di Bello are unreal. The carpaccio is huge! I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great Italian experience in a modern atmosphere. Ciao!

The service here is horrible! We sat we for 15 minutes before our drink our cane. We had to sit another 45 minutes before our meal came. There restaurant is empty. Nobody ever came to check on our drinks prior to our meal arriving. The meals came and he checked our meal one minute after the meal arrived and never came back to check on our meal or drinks. Our bread (2 servings)was never replaced

I will definitely give the an E for effort! Our server somewhat tried. I understand he was busy with three tables but he seemed to ignore me when I was asking about my drink. When he finally came I watched fix my drink as it is instead of making a new one. Now I have a watery him when I told him that it needs to be double strained!! Ugh!!! Our food was ok! I just expect edit to be bigger considering what I have seen in pictures on YELP!! Not very happy with this place! I'm only going to Town Square Brio!! They have better service there! I rarely give one star but this place really deserve it! If the have a no star I'd give that!! No wonder it slow here!! At least he knew the menu well!! Thanks for nothing Alberto! I think that his name!

This is my first time eating here and my second time eating at this chain. I wanted a Cesar salad with the same steak they out on the steak salad. The waiter who was rude from the get go said then I should order the steak salad with Cesar dressing with only romaine. Kind of odd but ok. When my salad came out it's had romaine lettuce, blue cheese Cesar dressing and a vinaigrette on it. We told him this is not what we ordered. He tried to argue with us and walked away mad. My salad was finally brought out correctly. 

Bad customer service and slow service

Love Brio! We met a group of friends for Happy Hour last Thursday. Exceptional HH menu with a very nice selection of $3.95 small plates and several wines and mixed cocktails below $5.  We had several rounds of appetizers (definitely try the shrimp and eggplant dish, the flat bread was popular with the guys).  Everyone appeared very happy with their drink drink selection. Service was good and the bar was very busy. No wonder!  Good job Brio! When will you be in La Jolla, CA?

I figured this was another one of those places that spent more money on decor than quality of food boy was I surprised.  We started with the bruschetta sampler I snagged a steak one with tomatoes parm and a nice hint of balsamic that was great the best thing I had that night.  Also got one of tomato and goat cheese ones which were pretty tasty too.  Next a salad with their creamy parm dressing which was balanced very well also.  Just enough cheese, onions, maters it was great.  Some others had the lobster bisque and said it was fishy even to seasoned fish eaters.  On to the pasta they had a fruit of the sea special which was great hint of spicy red pepper flakes a light sauce that didn't drown out the seafood.  I did have one problem with the dish I got 4 mussels maybe 3 oz of fish. Cut to the size of baby scallops and the scallops that were supposed to be in there were AWOL which is probably why the fish was cut that way.  Now the 4 shrimp I got in there were tender tasty and perfectly cooked just like the rest of the seafood were great but for me I would like to see alot more fruit of the sea. Service was friendly but not best I've had.  Overall a good place great tasting food and one of the few places that I've seen give more than a few raviolis in those dishes wanna go back and try the lobster raviolis and if that plate is smaller than mushroom ravioli plate I'm gonna be pissed.

Also the kids plates are really good and the portions are pretty big.

I took a young lady I liked to this particular Brio to celebrate her birthday. Such an amazing experience. Our waitress Brianne was astounding!! She provided the utmost customer service. Because of her the birthday was special. I'm super happy we came to this brio and had Brianne as our waitress. Ask for Brianne , she usually works at the bar section for happy hour

I love Brio.  Their outdoor patio is so much fun when the weather is not hellfire.  I recommend that you sit on the patio, order a bottle of wine and cheese, and enjoy the best Las Vegas has to offer.  I've been to Brio numerous times and consistently had wonderful experiences.  

Only once was there something that concerned me (undercooked meat).  Should they have caught this problem before serving the food to my guests and me, yes.  However, the chef and server both apologized and made things rights.  No harm was done, and I've never had any other bad experiences.

This is a place I love to visit.

Beautiful location!  We have eaten once outside, and twice inside.  The service has been very nice each time.  I've had the Mezza Chicken, Eggplant Pomodoro and the grilled Salmon.  I would order each of them again, very delicious.

The calamari on the other hand was too salty for me, but others in my party enjoyed it.  The Quatro Bruschetta was disappointment.  I did have a bruschetta on the specialty menu with proscuitto and asparagus that was very tasty and I would have again.

I don't recall the names of all the drinks that I have tried; one was a martini with Absolute Raspberry, pineapple juice, and cranberry juice (missing some ingredients).  It was incredible!  The only problem was that it didn't come in a bigger glass, (careful, this one goes down quick).  The other was a strawberry lemonade with fresh strawberries, fresh basil and prosecco.  I know, fresh basil seems strange, but I'm going to try and make this one at home, I loved it so much!

What a fantastic Thursday happy hour this place has! Delicious $2.95 appetizers, $5.00 martinis and great atmosphere. Though happy hour is limited to the bar area and outdoor couches, Brian the manager was kind enough to let us enjoy happy hour at the tables on the patio since the place was so packed. I wish I could remember the name of our server because she was excellent! The bartenders, Alan and Ashley make excellent drinks and always have a smile on their faces. Living in Vegas I've gotten used to the ubiquitous bratty restaurant managers, servers and bartenders who act like you owe them something - they should take a lesson from the staff at Brio Tivoli Village - they are amazing and I can't wait to go back!

Last night (New Year's Eve) was my first time at Brio, and my friend and I came in for dinner before going out. It was busy, which was expected, but were able to find a perfect little table for two in the bar area. I'm not going to sugar-coat it - once we sat down, we waited for a really long time to get our order taken, to get our wine and bread, and to get our meals. But on busy nights even at good places, things can go wrong - and I'm a firm believer that it is 100% about how staff and management handle themselves. Brio did an excellent job at recovering our experience. Our wine order wasn't put in and we had to flag the manager down after 15 minutes of wondering what was up, but she got our wine to us, and took the glasses off the bill. In fact, while we were having dinner, our server even brought us over two extra glasses. (The wine was delicious, one of their pinot noirs, but I can't remember exactly which one.)

I didn't know what to expect out of our food since I'd never been here, but I was really impressed - the food is so good! I had a hard time deciding between their chicken pesto pomodoro, the pasta alla vodka and the pasta brio, but I decided on the pasta brio (rigatoni, roasted red pepper sauce, mushrooms and grilled chicken) since it's their signature dish and came highly recommended by our server. It was SO delicious and very flavorful - it wasn't spicy but still had the kick I crave! My friend had their chicken pesto over angel hair and didn't really love their pesto- according to our server it isn't true pesto - its base is chicken broth? So maybe that was why. But he ate it and had some of my pasta brio, and we both agreed that dish was incredible.

Coming in on such a busy holiday, I think everyone at Brio handled themselves very well, even when there were mishaps. The atmosphere was really nice - had good lighting and seemed sophisticated but also jovial. And you can't beat the location - Tivoli Village is so pretty. I loved our experience here and can't wait to come back and bring my husband!

What the heck happened to this place? The service is now terrible. The girl who sat us was rude. I stated ahead of time we wanted a booth. I recently herniated three discs so sitting in a wood chair sucks for me. So of course they tried to sit us in wooden chairs. She had a mini fit when I reminded her I asked for a booth. Trust me it sucks to be young and have had an accident I don't need a 19 year old treating me like I'm being difficult.
To top it off it took twenty minutes for a waitress to come by. She seemed shocked no one had been by to take our drink order. By this time we had our menus sat to the side and were ready to order our meal. 
There's to many good restaurants in this town to deal with bad service.

We had a very nice dinner last Saturday night. The restaurant is a bit noisy but we were by the kitchen which is very open and visible. The service was very good and personable. The lobster bisk we had was ok, I didn't really taste any lobster. My wife's raspberry mojito was sweet but no punch. The dinner itself was very good, and they didn't overwhelm us with to much food. Then we busted the bar, and all the bar tenders were friendly. Over all this restaurant is worth the visit. Make reservations if your going on a Saturday.

Popped in here today for lunch with some coworkers- it's a lot closer to work than I thought! They were in an italian mood, but I was limiting carbs due to the night's Yelp Pizza Party, so I did not partake of any pasta during my visit. 

Service was fairly good- our server was very friendly and made a bunch of helpful chit-chat with us, mostly bonding with my dining companions over their love of carbonara, and discussing the best places in LV to get it. I appreciated his honesty in that he did not try to BS us about how the dish here is the best there is or anything, but he did say it was good- he personally does not like the use of spinach in the dish, preferring beans, but it's not offered that way here.

As it is, I debated between a few dishes- the shrimp mediterranean in particular, caught my eye. But I ultimately opted for the soup and salad combo, with the wedge and the lobster bisque- the salad arrived already doused in a sea of dressing, which surely took it far beyond the listed calorie counts. The bisque was an odd dish- the first bite wasn't that great to me, and I considered asking to switch it out for the tomato, but as I ate more of the dish it grew on me. Guess I'm just not a lobster bisque person? Duly noted.

My coworkers both opted for the carbonara- and both were underwhelmed with it. The dishes were huge, and they easily could have shared a single order instead of getting separate dishes, but one dish had overcooked pasta that was borderline mushy while the other was a good al dente. Both ladies were underwhelmed by their selection and had buyer's remorse, of a sort- commenting that they wished they'd gone with their original choices, but felt like the dish would be better here given the conversation with our server. Womp womp.

Seems like this place is best for a happy hour visit- I may need to take advantage of that, but I don't think I'm likely to return for lunch.

As a former employee for brio, i can honestly say their food is top-notch. I was there tonight for happy hour and the bar was really full but the bartender jim (james g) was outstanding and handled the high volume of customers with a sense of urgency and still made time to be personable to not only me, but almost everyone at the busy bar. 

The food is always amazing, and that goes for the happy hour food as well. Im glad i live close by now so i can visit more regularly here.

Love their food! We had my daughter's baptism party here and the manager Jenna was very nice and helpful during the arrangements.  The staff was very attentive the only thing is that it seemed they tried to get too many of us to sit in a too small of space so we were a bit squished. Other than that the food was of course excellent. 
We also have been there for brunch. Their breakfast food is not as good as their regular stuff.
Love the location. So nice to sit outside in the evenings and look at the surroundings.
really hard to go wrong with Brio. great food, the staff is always very pleasant to deal with even when they are super busy and you know they must be stressed

First time in this new location.

Meh.

Looks like they've fizzled out. Noting special. Nothing really good.
Love coming here!  Jeffrey, Mandy and Wendy are awesome bartenders! Always service with a smile! Wish I could come by more often! One of my favorite dishes is the black pepper shrimp with eggplant!

The Skinny: in general, below average Italian (2.5) service is very hit or miss (3) value: at $13-15 for an entree you could do much better elsewhere (2.5).

When we attended my Hubby's annual Christmas party, he had the unfortunate luck of winning a gift card for Brio Tuscan Grill. As soon as they called his name for the prize, my heart just sank into the bottomless pit of despair. Not to mention the hubs signed me up for their rewards program so I get a coupon now every year for my birthday. 

WTF!?!?!? I swear, my hubs hates me. As if it isn't traumatic enough getting 1 year older.

I can't tell you the amount of vitriol I have for Brio Tuscan Grill but that would take way more than the 5000 character limit that Yelp sets out for reviews.

I mean, it's not that the food is absolutely disgusting. It isn't. It's all edible. But that's about it. Considering the exorbitant prices for the level of cuisine, this joint represents all the things that are repellent about dining in the Summerlin area: generic, pricey for what it is, and a hot spot for the geriatric crowd whose taste buds have been ruined by the multitude of meds they take. And don't forget the f*(king patio dining. Like I said, mediocrity at its finest.

If you must come, come for lunch as the prices are a lot better.

Okay, seeing as I have been forced to eat here more times that I care to, I'll let it loose on a few of the many items I have tried.

Lobster bisque ($6.95): too much sherry not enough lobster = pass.

Salads (including Caesar, Grilled Salmon salad) are pretty bad here. Have yet to ever have a salad here without finding some wilted lettuce mixed in. In addition to that, the dressings are all really generic. And what the heck is up with all the cheese they put on everything? What is up with all this gorgonzola? Pass.

Calamari ($10.45/lunch price): First of all, the plating. Have no idea who thought that putting the marinara and cream sauce (neither one which is particularly good), in the same bowl of the fried calamari. This makes all the fried food soggy. Not to mention the deep fried peperoncini represents half of the plate of greasy calamari.

Mezza Chicken under the Brick ($14.85/lunch): The roasted chicken is fine, the marsala sauce is decidedly meh. The plate is very small for the $14.85 price tag. 

Pasta alla vodka ($16.15/lunch): My husband usually gets this. Me, I think it's okay. But given the price and the serving size, it's ridiculous. Pass on this one.

The only dish I have ever really truly liked there and thought that it was worth it was a special they had. It was a truffle oil flatbread with arugula, mushrooms and proscuitto. They had that for about $10.

Given that I would likely pass on nearly everything I tried there, I don't recommend coming here as for the above mentioned reasons. Though edible, their food is expensive for what it's worth. 2.5 starred review bumped down to 2 stars.

Love the happy hour. Out door seating is awesome, fast service and great food. The flat bread pizzas are great, but my favorite was the beef carpaccio. Only had the apps, but they were tasty enough we didn't need to order entres.

Three of us had a brunch today. Two of us ordered the Brio Hamburgers and one of our group ordered the Sicilian Omelet. The omelet was very tasty, but two of us got sick eating hamburgers.
Presentation- 8 out 10
Hamburgers were so dried and burned. A lady (she looks likes the manager of the Brio) asked us, if we ordered medium well. The server never asked us how our burgers like to cook. Arugula were wilted, French fries were too salty and hamburgers had no seasoning.
Sadly we wouldn't order the hamburgers any more.
Beautiful place and rotten hamburgers
I don't particularly like chains, but I tried it. The food is ok, but over-priced.  I have had better Italian food for this price range. I don't go here unless friends meet here for lunch.

I have discovered that although Tivoli has shops with price tags that make me want to cry, it actually offers a pretty wide selection of reasonable places to eat. Usually we go to Leone, but today I wanted to try Brio because I was craving pasta. 

The ravioli di bello was the perfect dish to satisfy that craving. I wish I had taken better note of what was in it, but basically it was cheesy mushroom ravioli with sautéed mushrooms and a chardonnay (it might have been some other wine) cream sauce. Yum yum yum yum yum. The flavors were developed very well, and it was indulgent without making me want to take a nap. Most of the items on the menu were within the $15-20 range, so you can have a meal with some friends and not break the bank. 

Our waiter was a little pushy when it came to add-ons like appetizers and desserts but it really wasn't that big of a deal. I will definitely be coming back for more!

The only reason I put 4 stars was because we sat in the happy our section outside and it took awhile for a waiter to come help us,but once Frank came all was well. He was a very nice waiter and our food and drinks came out fast. The service was great and the food was delicious. The happy hour menu is definitely worth while. We ordered the Brio burger which was perfectly cooked. We also ordered the eggplant fries, spinach artichoke dip,the sausage and pepperoni ricotta flatbread and the creme brûlée for dessert. Everything tasted wonderful. We would come back again for everything! I loved the food and the atmosphere.
Good food, good service, nice decor. A little on the pricey side but overall a very nice place for dinner.
Loved it Great Italian food great service my new favorite pasta place. Can't wait to try more

I hate to say this, but this place is lame.

We made reservations for 5 at 8:30. We came in and waited to be seated. There was no host/hostess at the front. Waited for a solid 10 minutes and finally 2 hostesses came and apologized for the wait. Why are there 2 hostesses if they are BOTH going to be occupied at the same time? Fine whatever.

Got seated outside. We made reservations for 5. Got four plates and sets. I asked for one more set... And I got the "Oh did I miss a set?" Yes you did. No biggie. 

Service is really bad. Not even mediocre, bad. Waited forever to get our orders in, very disappointing. I ordered the lasagna, but 20 mins into it (after we were served calamari and carpacciio, the only decent items on the menu), they came in to let me know they ran out. 20 mins later? Whatever, fine. They told me they could make me a spaghetti with bolognese sauce. I opted for that. Everyone's meal came earlier and they all waited for mine to come out (even though I insisted they go ahead and eat). I finally got this "bolognese" but it was like a pasta stew. Everyone knows bolognese is meat sauce and it's not supposed to be mushy and soggy and filled with sauce, but meat. It looked like they threw on the lasagna ragu. It was terrible! Even the meat of the sauce was not edible.

At this point I was done. My mother insisted that I let them know I didn't get what I ordered. I assumed that my voice wouldn't be heard considered the already bad service... but the Manager was the only redeeming quality of this joint: She offered an apology (that's all I expected), and dessert around the table. She didn't have to do that and that was nice. For that, they get one star.

Without it, it wouldn't be anything.

I would NOT come back here again and do not recommend this place for anyone who wants a romantic or nice italian experience. Bad food, bad service.

Went here for Easter brunch with my wife and a good friend. We sat outside on the patio and had a wonderful meal. The service was extremely courteous and friendly. Our food was served pretty quickly, and most importantly, it was delicious. We split an appetizer of bacon and tomato jam bruschetta with ricotta cheese and I would do it again in a heartbeat. I wish I could have taken a jar of that jam home with me. It was one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten. For my main course I had Gorgonzola-crusted lamb chops. They were cooked medium well, I asked for medium, but they were still great. The Gorgonzola crust was delicious and the mashed potatoes on the side were also quite good. It's a little pricey for brunch, but if you're not on a budget this is an excellent choice.

Something magical didn't happen this time or I was not in the right mood for Italian food. We usually go to the one in Town Square but this time it was faster to go to this one. 
Food was OK but lacked flavor. Mine was too salty and wife's plate was a little under-seasoned. Kid's portions are gigantic. Not that I mind taking stuff to go but I could split one portion for both of them. 

I think I'll take Brio off my "occasion dining" list for sometime. At least this particular location.

Have you ever gone to a dinner party & EVERYTHING tasted great...even though you had made that same thing yourself before and it was just OK?  That is how I feel about the food at Brio.  I have been to the new Tivoli location a few times now and love the happy hour. Be aware that because this is between Kona grill and Sun City, so there is a wide age range.  It had been a while since I had a 65 year old man hit on me, but it wasn't creepy...(is that creepy?).  Service is great each time but if you sit outside the sun just blares down during the happy hour.  The house white wine is nice and light and a reasonable price.  A nice place.  My friends and I really enjoy everything we have tried.

you can never go wrong with Brio. They have a good variety of options and pretty much everything on their menu is very tasty. I would highly recommend this place for happy hour. You can not beat their prices on their food and drinks
services: Good
prep time: 15 min
atmosphere:  trendy, clean 
Best Thing:  free bread !! :)

Wow - this place has gone downhill quickly.  My son came into town, and we picked him up at his hotel on the Strip, and drove the whole way out here because I had bragged on how good it was.  Well,needless to say, the service was terrible.  The food was mediocre.  We were overcharged ($15) on the bill - and we will NOT be back.  The bill was over $100 for 3 people, and the Pasta Brio which is usually quite good was dry, unflavorful, and very disappointing.  My son also ordered the Brio Pasta, based on my previous recommendation, and he did not even finish the dish.  We had to ask fro butter and bread three different times, and never received it. 
Also, if you are desirous of traditional Bruschetta, do NOT order the Bruschetta Quattro - it is bruschettas with red peppers all over them.  YUK!!  When I order Bruschetta,I want chopped tomatoes, cheese,cilantro and italian seasonings on toasted bread.  

I was embarrassed to have bragged about this restaurant that I have been to MANY times in the past.  However, I would not recommend it to anyone now.  I know my son was disappointed....and it made me sad because I wanted to enjoy a wonderful evening with him.  Shame on Brio for their decline.  We will NOT recommend or be back.  RIP OFF!

I have been dining here for about 2 years. The carpaccio, steak salad, & tomato soup are delicious. Happy Hour is wonderful for a meeting with friends. My family & I  return for the superb service.  We always request JOHN every time, he is a huge part of the reason we return quite often (so ask for John).

I love Italian - Armani, Dolce and Gabbana, Prada, Fendi, Missoni, but......

I must admit, I'm not a fan of chain Italian restaurants. I was raised by a real Italian mama and nothing comes close to her sauce, her meatballs, her pasta dishes. I am terribly critical of most Italian restaurants and therefore am very hard to please. 

I will say that Brio Tuscan Grille has thoroughly impressed this Italian palate. I avoided it like the plague when it opened at Town Square, but when it opened at Tivoli I decided to give Brio a chance. One chance!

Well it turned out one chance was all it needed because Brio knocked my Italian socks off. 

The pasta alla vodka was tremendous, with ricotta stuffed pasta in a cheesy cream sauce. The top was sprinkled with pancetta and basil and the dish was large enough to bring some home for lunch.

A friend ordered the lasagna and it was huge - seriously enough for two people.

On my most recent visit, we decided to hit the bar before heading over for some wine tasting. What a treat we found in that bar....in the form of a $2.95 menu!!! Wow, it was awfully tasty, and with such selections as ravioli caprese, shrimp and eggplant (EXCELLENT) and a gigantic burger. Oh and Wednesday is Martini night - $5 martinis -- yippee!!!!

Good food, good service, good prices. Seriously, what's not to love?
Food was fabulous! Came here for a late mothers' day dinner, best service I think I have ever received at a restaurant. Great job guys !

Very nice place. Great food. I tried the mixed grille. I love the spicy aftertaste.
The lobster soup was very good.

Our staple happy hour place for Italian!  The $2.95 appetizer menu is so great!  Try the Brio burger, the ravioli caprese, and the sausage and pepperoni flatbreads pizza!!

Great outdoor vibe to just chill when it's decent weather :)

I walked into this place for happy hour one evening expecting a few reasonably prices cocktails and a couple decent appetizers. I had experienced below average service here in the past, but nothing egregious. Knowing this, I had mentally prepared myself for the culinary adventure I was about to undertake... I sat down with a friend at one of the round tables in the bar area. I noticed the same waitress who had been my waitress the other times I had entered the establishment, the very same one who had given shotty service in the past. She was very busy talking to a woman seated at the bar, they appeared to be friends (I made eye contact with her about five times as I waited). I noticed the bar tender as I sat, Making eye contact with this gentleman multiple times. I sat for about 5 minutes, my excitement disappearing by the minute. Again, I made eye contact with the bartender. He went over to the waitress who was still talking to her friend and asked "are you going to take care of them?" being busy, she retorted "that's your job, my tables are all taken care of". They are arguing loudly, so the patrons in the bar could hear every word, for about 3 minutes. My friend was so embarrassed. Finally, the waitress came over and handed us menus, asked if we wanted waters, and would be back to take our order. We left the establishment. We went across the street to Made LV, and vented to the bartender there about this treatment. He laughed and said he heard it all the time. I wrote an email to the Brio corporate office relating this experience. A couple of days later, brio called, but I missed the call. I called back and spoke to the hostess, who took a message for the manager that I had called back. I received a call from the manager the next day, who apologized and was very sweet,  but also informed me that HER manager wanted to talk to me and apologize. It's been 2 and a half weeks and am still waiting for a call. By the way, first yelp review. 

-Russ

Yum! Went there for the first time last night with my girlfriends and it seemed lovely. Decently priced food, good service, and wonderful ambiance. I got the blackened tilapia meal served with veggies for around $15, got a peach Bellini and glass of prosecco (under $8 each) and a chopped salad to start. Love tivoli restaurants and the patio here allowed me to take in the feel of the cute village.

We got there at 11, just as they opened do there was nobody there. That was awesome! Our server was awesome too. He never let our glasses get empty, brought our appetizer out almost immediately, was ready to make suggestions on lunch, and brought out a dessert to celebrate my birthday after my hubby made sure he knew we were celebrating! The food was delicious! We loved the spinach and artichoke dip. The meals hit the spot too. The Alfredo sauce was super-rich and I couldn't finish it. My hubby also filled up in the dip so he couldn't finish his club sandwich. Yummy leftovers!!

My family and I literally didn't even get to sit at a table but the "We're just getting a table set for you." Yeah okay lady. 20 minutes later and still not seated! Nice. It was someone in a suit type thing that came up to us. Assuming she's a manager. The host and hostess both ended up seating a couple that came in 10 minutes after us. HA. What a joke. Off to cheesecake factory we went!

Great spot in Tivoli village...especially for happy hour.  I had cheese ravioli and it was amazing - and very cheap!  They also serve mojitos, which are one of my favorite drinks.  The scenery is usually pretty good and Tivoli village is a great cozy atmosphere.  Easy parking underneath and easy access from Summerlin Parkway make this a winner...

I love this place. Perfect every time. They hit the mark on food, atmosphere, price and service.  The complimentary bread basket is fresh and served with real butter. Most recently I had the fettucini rustica (ordered it with rigatoni instead).  Lots of chicken and sundried tomatos, but not oily and heavy like the penne rustica at Olive Garden. Very attentive servers. The only criticism would be the noise level.  This was a business lunch and at times it was a bit difficult to hear one another.  Must have been all the enthusiastic "yums".

Brio is definitely a house favorite for my family and I. We're definitely a regular for multiple reasons! 

From the lovely ladies who greeted us to the front to the gentleman that continued to monitor our table to make sure our drinks were refilled as well as our bread basket. Our server was and always is very friendly and needless to say patient. We're pretty indecisive mainly because every dish is so great. I usually don't step out my comfort zone and try new things but here I have no issue picking something new! Yes, I'm that annoying customer who will ask the server what their favorite dish is. I wanted something spicy so I got a pasta dish and as I write this review I've forgotten the name. The point is though you can't go wrong with whatever you choose. 

One thing I will recommend to fellow yelpers is you have to, HAVE TO try their Spicy Eggplant and Shrimp. Don't let the eggplant part scare you off. I know it's not everyone's first choice but you can't go wrong with this dish. It contains pan seared shrimp, Romano crusted eggplant and the best part the black pepper cream sauce. It'll immediately turn into one of your favorites. 

Also, this location had a great happy hour with live music on the patio! It seemed like everyone was enjoying their time while we choose to sit in dinning area. 

Great service, great dishes and a nice atmosphere; WINNING.

Always delicious. Still has the best lava cake I can find anywhere. The chicken limone is always delicious, as well as the Caesar salad. Pasta alla vodka was to die for! Also, get the bruschetta sampler if you've never had their's before. Guaranteed you will find a permenant favorite for the future.

This was a terrible lunch experience. We sat out on the patio by the door. The waiter wouldn't even come all the way outside he would just stick his head out and ask if we needed anything. The food was awful and if the waiter had actually come out we would have told him. Or possibly a big clue would have been no one finishing their food! Awful place, not ever going back!

I hadn't been to Brio in a long time but it was great coming back. The service was good and came right when I was ready to order. 

I ordered the spaghetti bolognese and lobster bisque. The lobster bisque was amazing as always. It was very creamy and the lobster was plump and flavorful. It's just too addictive! The spaghetti bolognese took much longer because they messed up by giving what the chef called spaghetti but was actually not. It was wayyy to thin and flat to be spaghetti. They remade it using actual spaghetti when I explained what spaghetti was LOL. (I would know because it's what I order every single time aEverything was very good and the view from Brio was beautiful on a sunny Saturday with the harvest festival going on in Tivoli Village.

Came here for dinner with the family the day after Thanksgiving.  It's located in  Tivoli Sqare,  The food was above average, restaurant is very nicely decorated, and the service was ok.  The price, $$$ not worth that.  I'd come back if there is no other place to go.
burnt dry chicken, way over cooked prime ribs. Very unacceptable. Price was higher than it was worth. There was no effort put into this food. It was rushed, fast food style. burnt.

Three of us took Mom here for her birthday, to try something new, for lunch.  It's in the trendy Tivoli Square which looks brand new and is stylishly done.  The walls, decorations, art and overall feel screams Italian countryside, complemented by the bright Vegas sun outside.  

We ordered one of the chicken sandwiches with the housemade chips, the mezzo chicken "under the brick", the grilled chicken risotto with sweet potatoes and I had the grilled shrimp with orzo.  Everything was good.  Nothing the blew us away.  The food is noticeably rich with butter and salt (fair warning for those looking for lighter, healthier choices) and is served in smallish portions perfect for lunch.  My family really enjoyed the housemade chips which were not salty at all and perfectly crisp.  

This place might have gotten an extra star if the service had been a little bit more personable and organized.  The waitress was friendly but she came back after our order and handed me a Caesar salad.  I looked back at her in confusion.  "I didn't order a salad."  "Yes, you did.  This is yours."  My aunt spoke up and said it was hers and she apologized but if I told her I didn't order it, I thought that should have been it.  

By the time we started eating, my mother still didn't have her side salad.  The waitress told us it would be right out.  After she'd brought it out, Mom said the girl dropped it on the table and said "here you are" while already looking to the next table and moving on.  Since she believes that service includes making eye contact with your customers when you are engaging with them, I'm mentioning it here.  

Otherwise, it was a good experience.  It's reaosnably close to Summerlin, but I think we'll continue exploring other Italian options before returning.
I always enjoy this very pleasant atmosphere at brio and my spaghetti with spicy sauce I come here for a special occasion to spend time with my family

Excellent food and wine.  The guy who brought our water and soda was funny and attentive.  Our server Julianne (girl) wasn't very impressive though.  My son is autistic and he shook her hands, after she took our drink order, my son wanted to shake her hands again, and she said "no more, we already shook hands."  I was shocked!

First time trying Brio was at Tivoli Village during happy hour. It was nice sitting outside until sunset cuz I felt like I roasted out in the sunlight. Aside from the tanning, the happy hour specials are f*ing great. There's a wide variety of $3 appetizers & discounted martinis to choose from & it turns out that my favorites were the margherita flatbread & lemontinis.

We had been to the sister restaurant in Town Square and food is always good there.
Was running errands this side of town and decided to stop for happy hour.
The staff was friendly and service was prompt. Food was delicious and portion was good size.
Will be back

Had lunch with some friends that live in Summerlin area.  They said Brio is a mixed  bag, sometimes good, sometimes average...Service was good, food better than Olive Garden.  probably would not go back.....

Great Italian food. Try the steak salad on the lunch menu. Very good! This location and the Town Square location, both have consistently good food and great service. The Tivoli Village location is closer to home, but they are both good.
